7KK8Vp-psdJy1ZY-aU7Mtg.text: There are four Thai Style Noodle House restaurants in Las Vegas. This is the second one. I have to say the place is clean and the food is very good. However, the service has a lot to be desired! When we arrived, the restaurant only had a few patrons. When we sat down we had to wait a bit for our drink orders(no big deal). When our drink and food orders were taken the waiter was not at all friendly. My meal came after about 10 minutes, I was given no extra plate, condiments, or napkins.The waiter then took a seat and finished his meal. My son's meal did not arrive for ten more minutes. Not once were we offered more soda or water. After we finished we asked for the check. The older woman handed it to me with out a thank you or a smile. We have been here several times and these two servers are EXTREMELY RUDE! How pathetic to dislike your job so much. I will not be back, I will just take my business elsewhere!

J8PoEyrUlvlX4o5tHqFnoQ.text: Actually went to this restaurant by accident thinking it was another Thai restaurant that I had researched earlier in the day. So many Thai restaurants on Fort Apache! Think they need to rename the street to Fort Thai. Anyways, the menu had a lot of choices but the one that stuck out for me was the duck curry. Two of my favorites duck and curry it was a no brainer. It was a really good first choice. Duck was tender and curry excellent with plenty of rice. Portion size wise I felt was perfect. Looking forward to going back and trying something else from the menu.

csp-b506wQPUisD2uD6K2w.text: Great food....horrible customer service. It took 10 mins to get water. I had to ask them to take my order. And when waitress was ready she made a smart comment about not taking my order because my phone was out.

KB6BwnUzyXqvaCwJLgrfnQ.text: Love the place, always quick food preparation and great prices. Have come here many times and will definitely come again!

akFV3ksgk8Wc8fLRCE0gwA.text: Yes ,this is #2 and sister to #1 on wynn, near chinatown. I've found this place while driving by and decided on lunch and have been very happy find,as their lunch special are reasonable and a fair selection to chose from.. Sometimes they forget to give lunch menu, if they do ,just ask...I never had to wait to get in,as I have been there at several different times for lunch and brought friends the last time. Fyi I found if you order any noodle dish to go,they will end up clumpy,best to eat them in the restaurant.. I prefer the red curry, and found it very tasty and of course a glass of thai ice tea to cool off the spices,lol.. I did find I prefer this thai place,then the ones around the corner,which are a little more pricey... Service has always been prompt and the only downfall is the napkin holder,which are not really napkin holder,but a small cup and I guess have to ask for any thai compliments for the table? I have yet to try #1,as last time there was a wait to get in and I was hungry and couldn't wait 30 mins...I prefer their 2 items lunch and will go back many times...yummy

EU7zaKliYGLYJnhIKD4ORA.text: All 5 stars here. Food taste like home, the prices are so cheap, they have great desserts and I'm never disappointed when I go back - so it's consistent.

TTrxiRk51OHn3KTOqstt1g.text: Honestly, I don't know jack about Thai food. I eat it occasionally, but not frequently enough to pick up the nuances of specific dishes. So, take this review with a grain of salt. The wife and I got takeout the other night. It's a cute little place... clean, modern, but small. The red curry with chicken that my wife ordered was hot. Very hot... at least for her. She got a level 5 and couldn't finish it because it was so hot. She also ordered extra veggies which cost a dollar. I don't like spicy food so I went with a 2 for my yellow curry chicken dish. Perfect (lack of) heat for me. It was tasty but could have used more chicken. I'd go back to try other dishes.

Y9GG1StYUPWGZRXWOI2VRw.text: Excellent food at great price!!! We always order the same dish every time we go ( every 2wks). LgAearecLSnnH-zqcvuKKg.text: We been coming here for lunch mostly TO GO.food is good we like it however,we noticed that some of the Guys that work there has mental issues.today me and my 9 year old son was there,when I was parking my suv,there was a red pickup truck door wide open,I just noticed when I was about to park this guy inside was very angry that I have to park right beside his truck and he insisted on closing his door.when I finally park my suv,he was cursing at me really angry and opened his door again..I was worried that my son was seating right beside his truck,we got down and i could tell that he was yelling at me but this time his door was closed now.then he was opening his door like he's trying to scare me.anyway,having my son with me I just went straight to the restaurant.I complained to the people inside working.and they said yeah "HE WORKS HERE and Hes a little crazy" and he told me to go ahead and beat him up?? so I was like what?? the guy inside said "we feel the same way".I just said I am getting harrased w my son and if I call the cops were gonna have a big problem.no response exept that he want me to beat him up!?this is not the first time theres also a younger asian guy that has a very bad attitude working in there and he seems like hes always angry about somethings.This is a really bad experience that I have decided to not to come back there.weird people working in there pushing me to fight with my son with the crazy guy.

VIRInz9zcZazHZjOjqcy1A.text: Their appetizer fried wonton is the best! it has that zesty sweet taste to it which I love! I would say its the only thing i order from the appetizer menu. Haven't tried it yet?! i suggest you should!

AS63LQIJ4v4XTBjIaIvepQ.text: Came to eat here with my kids the other day, I am very critical of my Thai food since I have been to Thailand and have alot of Thai friends who cook authentic meals for me. Heard really good things about this place from coworkers so I figured I would try it out. I drove pretty far to check out this restaurant since I live on the opposite side of town but it was well worth it. It was a Saturday and I was greeted right away which is always a plus, we sat by the fish tank, it kept the kids occupied for awhile. I ordered the papaya salad, tom yum soup, pad see ewe , and bbq pork. The papaya salad was good but a little too sweet for my taste. Tom yum soup was delicious as well as the bbq pork. My kids liked the pad see ewe but to me it was just ok. I would actually only rate the food 3 1/2 stars but the reason it got 5 was the service was great. Our waiter was very nice and attentive, and he was able to comply to all my special requests (since my kids are picky). it usually is hard to find really good service in Asian restaurants because they usually hire people with no personalities and don't speak that much, and I was happy to have a waiter that could not only conversate and make me laugh but more importantly make my kids happy. It always makes life easier when they know how to handle kids and keep them happy so it makes it easier to enjoy my meal. Definitely will come back and bring my friends, hopefully my expectations will proceed me.

6JqYsmXb0XHNztxRMsem2w.text: We went to the restaurant around 10pm and they will close in 30mins. The lady host with short hair look like she get mad with us:( No one come to ask about what we wanna drink!! They were sitting/texting near our table... I always come to Noodle House #1 but thought ta try this location (Noodle House #2)... waste of time n gas.  We drove across to try their food but they acted like they don't want customer.

C9M7exPHRbYcgZyDH2g1ZQ.text: My review is probably closer to a 3.5 than a 4, but since Yelp does not permit 1/2 stars, I did not want to unfairly punish the place by only giving it 3 stars. For a quick and delicious lunch or dinner, this place does it right.  The curry with duck is my fav.

n9rmLi46hO8KZwoBcCDn9g.text: The food is very good. I had the fried chicken and rice and it was incredible and its right around the corner from my house!

dcI-vknfyZjNwfSExSoDcg.text: Visited last night , beef panang curry not as good as first time . Yellow curry with chix and pumpkin really good .  Eggplant with chix very good same as last visit. Still a very good restaurant. Service very good.

ihgQdeyQhhO66Jyuo5ADHQ.text: So, the good, the bad, the ugly....  Mostly the Good!  in 200 words or less!  The good: Great prices (GREAT prices) Good portions (not great) Very good food with wonderfully aromatic and flavorful sauces  The bad: As some other reviewers noted, the chairs need to be cleaned or re-upholstered The place plays like a take out place that coincidentally has tables - as a result the service isn't amazing, its not BAD, but its just not great.  That said, for this price, you can't get amazing service, or the place goes belly up because the economics stop working with that additional server. Staff is friendly and helpful.  The ugly: We ordered vermicelli chicken noodle soup.  The soup was GREAT.  We ordered vermicelli because one of the people in the party had an egg allergy.  We asked when it arrived, and they confirmed it was an egg noodle dish.  They offered to replace it (thank you), but the definition of vermicelli (confirmed with wikipedia) is a rice noodle The Red Snapper tasted more like Tilapia  Look, the food is quite flavorful, and well prepared.  The prices are GREAT.  There are flaws, but we will surely be back.

vY1AIyC0HbruSICq8ECfTA.text: I would give it 4 and 1/2 stars as this place is our friends' favorite place for noodles.  It is small but clean.  We ordered chicken satay for appetizer, tasty and sliced beef flat noodles with bok choy, barbecue pork wonton rice noodle soup, seafood crispy noodle with wonton with gravy, and gold/silver noodle with chicken and shrimp.  All had big portions except for the gold/silver noodle which was smaller than before.  Prices are reasonable for what you get!

Food is awesome as the flavors are authentic and explode in every bite!  Can't beat the prices either!

q9AMUF-hTIqdSCfjumbArg.text: Although the service was prompt, we did have to ask for smaller plates for our appetizer which seems out of the norm... We had pot stickers and they didn't have a lot of sauce unlike my previous visits which was disappointing. The Thai tea is always a must. The worst is the flies that were everywhere. It was super unappetizing and gross. I had to keep swatting my hand around our food to make sure they didn't land.  5 mins of doing that and the waitress didn't bother coming to see what was wrong and there was two of them working. I hailed her down asking for a check and to go. While waiting I did notice the fish tank they have is full of algae. We just couldn't eat there anymore... probably not going to come back which is a shame because this spot used to be really great!

HlWaV5pj98M1J4JfOp3ssQ.text: It's been YEAAARS since I ate at this location and it's still good! I used to go to the Wynn location a lot back in the day, but this one seems newer. This location has been open for a long time now and it still looks like a good environment to dine in. As far as food quality goes the two locations I've been to seem to have the same taste. They have never disappointed me as far as their food, but the real take from this place are the prices. Everything is pretty cheap and they give great portions! My girlfriend and I were able to share an order of pad Thai noodles and beef jerkey. She also got an order of their thai tea. We spent less than $20. I remember I used to get their BBQ combo you find on the back of the menu. It comes with sticky rice and papaya salad. That was always my go to. The servers were welcoming and I can tell they've gotten to know a lot of the regulars there. I forgot how good this place was for a quick thai fix. Definitely will be back.

pkN6GQ71WCThZ7C0dpgOTg.text: Food - 3/5 Service - 4/5 Cleanliness - 4/5 Overall - 3.6/5  Decided to try this place out because a friend was on his Vegan diet and this restaurant has Vegan choices. I never had the other location but he said this restaurant wasn't bad for having a variety of choice. This location is in the same plaza as Sweet Addiction and where Raw Foods use to be.   --------------------------------------------Food - 5/5--------------------------------------------------- 4 different types of noodles you can choose with your different soup bases. I tried the Beef stew with rice noodle. My friend had the chicken broth with rice noodles and my other friend had Vegan Curry.  The Beef and Chicken broth noodle didn't have much flavor. The broth didn't taste as I expected and wasn't seasoned properly.   ----------------------------------------------Service 4/5------------------------------------------------- The service was standard for a fast food place. It wasn't extremely good but it wasn't bad either. The service was quite fast and when they messed up on my friends order, they automatically took it back and corrected it before serving the food.  --------------------------------------------Cleanliness - 4/5--------------------------------------------- The location was clean front of house. Some of the furniture was worn down and old but it was still clean.   Overall Ok food for good price, fast and decent service. The location was good for a fast dinner   choice that cater to vegan clientele.

JgI1XPb6Mqr60IhEkyM7BA.text: Probably one of my favorite new finds in this city.  I was craving noodles one night so I yelped for good noodles in this city for vegetarians. This place popped up. Originally I tried the Chinatown location and loved it so last night I went to this location. It was just as good as the one in Chinatown. I liked the service better at this one.  I ordered the Pad Thai and when she asked what meat I would like I told her I don't eat meat so she asked if I wanted tofu. It was not offered on the menu so I was pleasantly surprised. It's always nice to be offered different options in proteins instead of just settling for no protein at all.   My boyfriend ordered the sliced beef noodle soup with vermicelli. He loved it. He said it was probably one of best soups he's had. The soup had a dark rich colored broth that looked and smelled really good.   We'll be coming here more often!

sMAXGykz--rSLJej997xMw.text: This place was a bust. If you have ever been to David's restaurant pan Asian you will leave here disappointed. The food was not as nearly as tasteful as pan Asian. I ate pad se ew and bit into a bone in my chicken. The sauces were watered down and food was mediocre. Unlikely will be returning. I'll pay a little more for amazing food elsewhere.

wW_hkhXh9i40so4w4WepDA.text: I finally had a visit to the infamous second TSNH.  Some folks say it doesn't live up to the original.  I am here to say that it does!  This is by far the best Thai restaurant on this side of town.    We ordered the Khua-Kai, the combination Beef Noodle Soup (with glass noodle), and a dish not even offered on the menu.  Every single dish tasted just as good as the other Thai Style Noodle House, which is saying a lot.  Thai food is difficult to cook, and a lot of places have a disparity between the original chef and new chefs.  TSNH2 does not suffer from this hurdle as much as other Las Vegas Thai restaurants have shown in the past.  The Khua-Kai was spot on with the noodles and the sprouts and the homemade sweet and sour sauce.  We quite enjoyed it.  It was a nice balance to the spicier dishes that we ordered.  The combination Beef Noodle Soup is a must try at TSNH, as far as I am concerned.  The broth was just as rich and flavorful as the original location.  Most Thai places use a rather thin broth for this dish, but TSNH uses a thick and creamy beef based broth that cooks all day long.  Its just amazing.  I had this same soup at the original TSNH yesterday, and today at the new location it tasted exactly the same.  Loved it.  Overall, if you live in this part of town, this is the Thai restaurant to go to.  It is the most authentic out of the other spots located in this area, and it just tastes better.  Compared to the original, the interior is much nicer (newer building complex), but you will still see some familiar faces.  Awesome Thai food here!

zRbsAlqnB8ROIzMB9EOqNg.text: Great food and flavors with authenticity...To top it off great prices. My fav's are lard-na, pad thai, beef noodle soup. Great place to satisfy your cravings for Thai food.

UxPNpzKEC4FpdidHz8MCcA.text: Thai house 2 has been my go to place for fast inexpensive Thai food. It's less crowded than the one on Spring Mt., both are great and customer service is the only thing that's inconsistent. But overall food is always good. We've tried everything on their menu and all was good.

I2P9qMB4DhayOGSwLkXqqA.text: Went here for the first time and got their yellow curry with chicken, crab fried rice, and chicken pad Thai. I literally ate every last drop! Everything was delicious and I will definitely be back! Great fast, and friendly service!

u9ht2Mi6U8VoSBgMW_B3lg.text: I came here on a sunday to have a date with me, myself and I, and I was dying of hunger. Okay, well not exactly dying, but I was super hungry, since I didn't eat anything that day.  Anyways, onto the review:    I was immediately greeted and seated seconds after walking in, then asked what I would like to drink.  I received my water and ordered larb with regular rice, and calamari with sweet sour sauce. Now I loved how much 'meat' you get with the calamari, but I didn't like the sweet and sour sauce paired together. I liked the larb, but not 'in love' with the larb because it was drowned in sauce that it was getting harder to eat towards the bottom of the plate.   Towards the end, I had to stop a server for a box, and normally when one does that you receive a check.  I received my box and put my leftovers away, while waiting for a check.  I waited another minute or two and realized the server was just talking with another server that I had to interrupt her.  Other than that, it wasn't so bad. I'm willing to go back.

2agyZE6HE6tt5BT1AM84Sw.text: This place is really going bad. Its cheap but the food not that good especially the pad thai.. it tastes sour. We used to come here often but everytime we go, the food keep getting worst. I keep saying give it a try again and looks like its just doesnt taste as good as the first time we came here. Well I guess you get what you pay for. Even if its cheap its not worth the money. Still surprise alot of people still give it 5 satrs.

qrXFStOs3yv1OGyzSDykEg.text: This location is a bit far from where I live but I like it the best of this brand. It's a little better than a hole in the wall, but the food is good. Cheap, straight forward Thai food. My only gripe is that they don't have Thai chilis in fish sauce as a condiment. It's not the best Thai I've had but satisfies any Thai food craving.  My go to dish is the spicy eggplant with fried tofu. My son loves the pad see ew (spelling?) with chicken. Their pad thai is also good. My husband likes the Penang curry. Their papaya salad I think is the most authentic in Vegas. We've had ginger chicken, steamed snapper, and tom yum goong as well. I think we've had other dishes, but we get the ones over. Oh, that's right the basil chicken.   You can't go wrong. It's tasty.

EFFrDuGh_l5Fh1b8Vb7sDg.text: I just discovered this place last week and yet I have been three times already! I have only had the yellow curry with chicken and the fried bananas for dessert. dwPXEkil6JOEJ0tPPrRDLA.text: Love this place! Discovered this place back in 2013 and have been coming back ever since, their noodle house pot stickers are one my faves and a must try, their noodle soups are also big size and fill you up very quickly, Highly reccomend this place! 10/10

rGPGpDLDmlRy5z0RNRnriQ.text: Been going here for a few years now. Would be 5 starts but lately my orders to go have been a hit or miss taste wise. Just doesn't seem very fresh.

r7ET1XQNBTLazTPq1R5NCg.text: I recently walked into the Thai Style Noodle house 2 on Jones and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered 2 Chicken noodles soups and a red curry with chicken. Food was amazing. I spoke with a gentleman named Victor before I left. He was very nice and made sure we were taken care of. I will definitely be back in to eat. Thanks Victor for making our first time at your restaurant amazing. I will recommend this spot to my friends.

PLfdj5jygef_VjTt4ecX6Q.text: I may not be the best to read a review from because I order the same thing every single time.  Yellow curry with chicken, no potatoes, no potatoes and extra chicken.   I think it's some of the tastiest yellow curry around.   Plus the prices are very solid (I think my meal is like $8).   Most places are at least a few dollars more for the same thing.  They are weak with the spicy.  When they ask what level of spicy I want from 1 to 10, I always say 20 and tell them I want it really really really hot.   To the point that I'll cry from the heat.   And maybe one out of 8 times it's as insanely spicy as I want it.   It's always tasty though.   As always they give not nearly enough rice as you need (but no Thai place does) so I just make more at home and usually turn my dish into 2 meals.    I usually choose take out but sometimes I eat in.  The service isn't too great.  They get the waters to you pretty quickly and take your order fast but you hardly see them after they bring you your food.   Slacking on the water fill up a little usually but it's all good with me.   I'll go up to the counter if I need something which is slightly inconvenient.    The place is modern and clean on the inside from what I can see (their chinatown location is pretty gross, I wouldn't eat there) but I never got a gander into the kitchen.   I've had the beef pad-see-ew (probably bad spelling) and thought it was a nice portion and tasty.     If they could step up the spicy and have better service Id give them 5 stars.   If you want quality, nice portions, tasty and a respectable price point, give this place a try.

6dNUWdlqGKSykKe7pCVubw.text: I love Thai food. I admit I was not a foodie until I met my girlfriend and one of my favorite cuisines now is Thai. I am convinced that there is no better restaurant than Kung Fu Thai, but I am always happy to keep searching. This place was good and more than that, it was surprisingly cheap. My FAVORITE was the papaya salad...oh, my, god. I was craving it the next morning and I will definitely be returning to this place. The reason for four stars instead of five was because when we walked in we noticed a sign that said debit card machine was not working. All we had was a debit card so we asked before we sat down. No one had any idea if the machine was back up LOL. All they said was 'i dont know' then walk away. Maybe I was just hangry but that really annoyed me. The food made up for it though. Try this place.

zrz9CoKq3NuAQ3jvljUMPQ.text: my go to  i always get the crab fried rice, chicken pad thai, beef pad see, and crab rangoons  can never go wrong  all 10/10

Lr_BsX4l-RCc2jwoHUCn9A.text: I dont know why I haven't reviewed this place since we've been coming here for about 5 years now. Anyway, to start it off, I'd like to explain that the 1 shy of star from a 4 star is due to the piece of hair i found on my Pad Thai from my to go order today and inconsistent service. The service in this place is almost always bad for both dine in and to go orders. But I wont complain too much since husband and I choose to come back over and over again. It's not the best Thai food we've had in town but it satisfies a good Thai food crave. We come back for the consistency in taste and price. My husband and I probably only cook at home twice a month so the rest of the days, we eat out twice or three times a day even. This place is one of our cheap spots. If you might wonder what's the best Thai food we've had in town so far is my friend's family home cooking lol jk. Im saying, I'm not Thai but have had good home cooked Thai meals so I know what to compare restaurants dishes to. I really like Archie's on Sahara and Fort Apache the best so far. And the worst would have to be Thai Place on Maryland and Flamingo. We've had quite a few different dishes from here over the few years and haven't really been disappointed. We've had some of the Chinese dishes as well, Sweet and Sour and Orange Chicken, etc, but I wont recommend them since...why would I when you're at in Thai restaurant? Kids love them though.  Dishes that we usually order on repeat and highly recommend are: Pad Thai and Papaya Salad of course, Pad See Eu/Ew, Rad Na, Yellow Curry, Panang Curry, Pineapple Curry, Cashew Nuts rice plate, Spicy Basil Leaf rice plate, Grill Salad, and Crab Fried Rice.  Ok dishes: Three Companion, Tom Yum, Khua Kai, Pineapple Fried Rice and Spicy Basil Leaf Fried Rice.  Would not recommend: Pra Ram rice plate did not look nor tasted appetizing at all.  Their menu says Vegetarian options are available upon request on each items on the menu. If you are a True Vegetarian then make sure to ask about fish sauce on the dishes. I am a Pescatarian so I usually order dishes with Tofu (steamed sometimes fried) or sometimes Shrimp. My husband eats chicken and beef. All the dishes I mentioned above are good with all, chicken, beef, shrimp and tofu.  I love spicy food but am not a champ at it and my husband is not a fan. But Thai restaurant spice levels are nothing compared to home cooked Thai spice level. So most patrons should be safe here. I usually order spicy level 7/8 for a good heat and still enjoy or even 10 if I want a challenge since I need to drink lots of water since I didnt the past days lol. I can handle them but my husband's limit is 5.  TSNH 2 location is closest to us since it's on the outskirt of Summerlin South. We've also been to the one in ChiTown and Jones but TSNH 2 is better.

3HGGqXmsluahuT0gA6fVFw.text: My go to restaurant. Prices are affordable and food is really good. I order the beef pad sew ew and the chicken fried rice on a regular. I love this place!

kZnDB0fYyTio5MeXMileNw.text: There's a ton of Thai restaurants to choose from, but this place is not too shabby. Service is great, and the food has been good so far.   Appetizer combo platter- 4 star. You can get a taste of the crab rangoon, fried tofu (wasn't a fan), egg rolls (kinda like the plain veggie style at panda), fried shrimp (delicious), chicken satay (amazing). I think it's a nice platter to get a taste and all for $8.95 or so.   Noodle soup with chicken and bean sprouts in chicken broth - 5 star. I got it with flat noodles. Spice level 7. Delicious!  Crispy pork and chinese broccoli- 3 star. The pork tasted a bit off, and it could have been crispier. I've had better, but wasn't too bad.   Spicy seafood fried rice- 4 star.   Pad See Ew- 4 star.  Glass noodle salad- 4.5 star.  It's clear noodles tossed in lime. Delicious!

hWEnfjFNzjYHD9Xj8_zIww.text: The Ft. Apache location of the Thai Style Noodle House may be the sister to the Chinatown original, but they hail from a different mother.  To be sure, the food is almost as good as it's more popular sibling, but that is no surprise, assuming the recipes got passed along at birth. But that's where the similarities end with this western valley reproduction of a well-loved Chinatown eatery (which is sad news for those of us who live in the western valley).  In my review of the original, I bemoaned the absence of an accommodating server who could provide the suggestions I crave when on a maiden voyage. It is fair to assume the language barrier played a significant role in this, but the server did do an excellent job with everything else - and I had Yelp to help out with the suggestion portion.  The same could not be said for the Ft. Apache location. Not only was there no perceivable language barrier, but, as the only customer during the lunch "rush", the server was presented ample opportunity to showcase his skills. It is here where he failed -monumentally.  It's hard to describe the feeling of invisibility, especially if the reader has never experienced such loneliness or felt the overwhelming desire to do a Huckleberry Finn on the fence post. It is especially difficult to imagine being ignored when you are the only customer in the place. Suffice it to say, I nearly had to cry out in anguish EVERY time I needed anything, from placing my order to requesting a refill to procuring the check.  Not only did the server not care about my presence in his establishment, he seemed perturbed by the rare interaction he did have with me. To add insult to massive injury, his response to my credit card was (and I quote) "Don't you have cash?" (picture Paris Hilton discovering her rental choices did not include a pink Cadillac Escalade.)  I half expected the bill to arrive in some minimum $25 charge, as some restaurants are wont to threaten with their little placards next to the register.   I was delighted to see that the server only charged my card the exact amount of my bill - it was, sadly, the highlight of my visit.

uA8ZUbuebjbPz5s6DzWRWA.text: After many harrowing experiences with Thai restaurants recently, it is good to return to a solid, familiar place. They have all the Thai classics and then some, with some nice duck and seafood dishes that aren't on the menu at other places. Their duck dishes are a bit too rich to eat alone, but are so satisfying at the right amounts. The seafood dishes are fresh and speak much to the quality of the fish. There's a bit of an issue with spiciness, though - this is one place that could stand to develop a better spice scale, especially since they excel in other flavor categories as well.  The servers here are friendly and very efficient. They seem happy, which makes the whole establishment seem happy, which makes even the busy nights just more bustling than hectic. Again, a solid, familiar place for just good Thai food.

JOh1f1GUJSuiYk2OjlP-nw.text: Delicious food, affordable,big serving and nice staff.. Definitely going back here... We ordered the chicken curry and fried chicken on fried rice we love it along with the thai tea :)

vtgmTeZPYCmYoUv8vFiCqg.text: I went here twice in a row in two days for dinner and both times I broke out in hives on my face, hands and chest. This is the only thing I've done the same the past two days. I had vegetarian panang curry and vegetarian egg rolls both times. This is enough for me to never eat here again (I am a customer who has come back 10+ times,) but after witnessing multiple health code violations on top of this, I will never come back.   The health code violations are: 1) eating and not washing hands before serving food, 2) putting fingers and/or thumbs inside of a serving dish 3) not wearing proper hair nets when preparing or serving food (I have found hairs in my food or the food of my friends while eating here)  It seems like this place is going downhill fast.   DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

M-LpMND3jjGQ2zWMvpJ1XA.text: Food is great, but their service is horrible, they show a lot of attitude, been to two of their Locations - the one on Fort Apache and one on Spring Mountain Rd, at both the locations the food is amazing (as if the chefs making food are cloned :-)) , but both the locations the service is horrible, I visit to one on Fort Apache, food can't go wrong anytime - it comes fast and taste exactly as expected always, so is their service pathetic and with don't care attitude. vqdJNNa7dy-H0u6oba9MUA.text: Reasonably priced great food. Tasty papaya salad, tom ka gai, and green curry. Service was great. Would come back again when passing through Vegas.

yBvIBKwzWP_833pm7NLo4A.text: Good food, prices ,$7-8, portions could be a little larger. Nice ambiance. Fast friendly service.

ftQG6EXZRl7c4x7srnliJQ.text: Hands down the best Thai in town!!! A must try! I've tried to order something different everytime I'm feeling Thai food and haven't found anything I didn't like!

H9wzW8mNiqHCut7nP3gRwA.text: Thai Style Noodle House was worthy of two visits within a week - lunch specials are a great deal here so we couldn't resist returning!  From 10:30 am to 4 pm, lunch specials are in full swing.  (This applies on weekends too!)    For $5.95, you choose one item from their list and you also get soup of the day, steamed rice, and choice of appetizer (fried tofu, egg roll, or fried wonton).  For only two dollars more ($7.95), you can make it a two item lunch special from their list.  That's a pretty good deal already!  Soup of the day (on both visits) were an egg drop soup that had chunks of goodies in it and fried garlic on top.  A nice start to lunch.    First visit, the Husband had the two item lunch special - Fried Garlic and Pepper Beef and the Panang Chicken with the Fried Tofu appetizer, whereas I had the one item lunch special - Yellow Curry with Tofu with the Fried Wonton appetizer.  With the two item lunch special, we thought they would give him less of each, but it was actually two full regular lunch portions.  Definitely a great deal!  They even asked if I wanted soft or fried tofu for my entree choice.  My curry was loaded with lots of veggies - carrots, string beans, bamboo shoots, napa cabbage, and baby corn.  All their entrees were good and tasty and we were both pleased with our choices.    On our second visit, we both got the one item lunch - the Husband stayed with his Fried Garlic and Pepper Beef Choice with the Fried Wonton appetizer while I had the Panang with Tofu with Fried Eggroll appetizer.  They did get our spices mixed up on this visit though.  I requested medium while the Husband asked for spicy.  His has no spice while mine had all the heat.  It was still good nonetheless.  Be sure to ask for the Thai condiments - sometimes they automatically give it to you while other times you have to ask for it.  Their version of Thai iced tea is pretty good and a steal at $1.75.  Service is fine - both times we went was after the lunch rush so we were attended to as needed.  Overall, Thai Style Noodle House ranks up higher than some of the other Thai restaurants in the area offering lunch specials.  Minimum $15 for credit card use.

6fvSmRufZTdRDyqgnTjpiw.text: My wife and I ate here last night as recommendation of a friend. The menu was extensive,  the restaurant was clean, food was very good but the service was GREAT!  Victor greeted us and lead us to our table. We ordered spicy eggplant (good) pad Thai noodles (better) and yellow curry (best). But it was Victor who made our evening. He took time to explain several items on the menu and told us about their other restaurants (they have 4). You cannot beat the value either. Nothing on the menu is over $9. We will most certainly return.

vGuoaPI5AhWzt7q6YJWbzg.text: I like this location than the other one on Spring Mountain, not just because its nicer but the staff is way more friendly. I love the pad see yew (idk if I spelled it right haha) with flat noodles. Everything is less than $10 which makes my wallet happy. I also like the beef noodle soup & the fried rice. Can't beat the prices here for delicious Thai food.

Krtf469AUCNX-9gM8r2Qrw.text: Best Thai in town and somehow it's one of the cheapest too. Fantastic pot stickers. Love the spicy basil fried rice. Great service. Full scores across the board.

hUBCQOTyNpzp3pePNEI2Jg.text: Let me start by saying I was a fan.  I have been to both locations. I stopped going to the other because of sanitary reasons. I saw the dude cooking on the wok sneeze in to his hand, then continue cooking. I asked the waitress and she said, "no he did not" ... OK ... gross.  Then here ... previously, cheap and decent Thai food.  Until this week. Ordered food ... it came, the pot sticklers which are usually excellent were dripping grease and covered/swimming in sauce. Not a good start. The soup and salad came, and so did a little friend walking across the floor.  Actually not so little. A roach in the middle of the dining room. When I went to the manager/cashier about it, she said they have no problems - they spray all the time. I said then what about the roach in the middle of the restaurant, she said it must have come from outside. (After leaving the business, not one roach, anywhere.) I find this very hard to believe when on previous experience I had health concerns with their other location - in fact, I just learned the other location was temporarily closed by the Southern Nevada Health District last month. I think it is time for an inspection of this location as well.  For what it is worth, I offered to pay, I kept asking how much do I owe you - I kept asking, again, kept asking - yet she was on a very long conversation in Thai (I assume with an owner) about the roach issue. She did not make me pay, which in all honesty is what should have been offered in the beginning, since we did not eat and we were interrupted by pests.

QPpFbBOZDmpIJNhBGO8S2A.text: Fantastic. The food was great. We were looking for something that wasn't China a No-No. We found the right spot. Orange chicken was perfectly crisp. Kids ate it up and no complaints. Not that Panda is worth comparing to but it is the kids choice and they usually complain when other Orange chicken doesn't taste right. We had a combo appetizer plate which was a great assortment. Thai chicken skewers were fantastic. Edamame was lightly salted and wonderful  Me had chicken curry and chicken pad Thai. Loved them both. We could have shared either dish because the portion size was nice. Not crazy large but a healthy portion.   Although we didn't partake in desert they had a nice menu. Price was perfect. They don't serve fountain drinks. This usually annoys me but at 1.25 per can I spent less on drinks than any chain restaurant. I even had TWO cans!!!    I think you should try this place.

irYk34u9vq6srpKoImEJ2w.text: I love this joint! Food feels like a warm hug on a cold winter's night. Always comforting to know they are just around the corner when I am craving the noodle house. I always order the chicken noodle soup with flat noodles.

Znnzp7QD5OvPOm1LKbCrLg.text: I was starving after working for a bunch of hours at work. I was really craving  Asian food and my friend mentioned that he was getting Thai food. I rushed to Archie's since I LOVE their basil fried rice. It's amazing, but sadly they were closed. There are a bunch of Thai restaurants in this area, but this was the only name I remembered, so I decided to try it. I ordered Pork Pad Thai and Chicken fried rice. I ordered take out and my food came out pretty quickly. The service wasn't that great. Typically whenever I order to go, other places always offer me water, this place did not. They also did not offer me a place to sit. I just sat down. Maybe I just have different expectations?   Their Pad Thai was weird. It was very dark and kind of clumpy. It wasn't horrible, but not the best I've ever had. My friend had Thai food from Weera Thai, and their Pad Thai was a lot lighter. I normally don't order Pad Thai, but I was starving and for some strange reason I wanted Pad Thai. The fried rice was pretty good. It just wasn't the same as I was looking for. I ordered a spice level of 7/10, and none of the dishes were spicy at all. I was worried that 7 would be too spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all! It was kind of disappointing, actually.

uJnP_ZRI371uYGk2szGqaQ.text: We love Noodle House#3 on Rampart n Lake Mead.  But At #2 is kind of disappointed.  It was salty and greasy. The service was ok.

YLtsUxzvXwEMqv3rs7RgEQ.text: I was in the neighborhood & decided to try out the 2nd TSNH location, being that I am a fan of the original one ;)   I ordered the Roasted duck noodle soup & some pineapple fried rice.   The broth for the soup was a little sweet for me, but it was very good, especially after I added the spicy condiments ;)   The Pineapple fried rice was just as awesome as at the other location.   I had saved room for dessert & was looking forward to some fried banana with ice cream & honey, but alas, they were all out of bananas :(   This location is probably as small as the other one, maybe slightly bigger. Very clean & friendly staff.   I would definitely come back ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GuEaZyK07Bfb9SIDlBEqyQ.text: Fifth time here now.   They can never seem to get my order 100% right no matter what I order.     Example - Forgot my salad on two visits.  Forgot to bring ice coffee until end of meal.  Ask for level 3 spice on squid salad and they bring me level 69 of hell.    Every time is something.     Food -   it's no Lotus of Siam but if ur craving Thai beef noodle soup or duck curry, this place will do.

I7smxBfoRsQWbk2NAWLWNw.text: Went here for a late dinner after my son's soccer game and we were not disappointed.   Going into a Thai restaurant I always tell myself, "The service is going to be bad, but that's okay.. I am here for the food" and that's exactly how this restaurant was. Great food, bad service.   My wife and I ordered a well received yelp favorite here, the Pineapple Fried Rice, which was FANTASTIC! Throughout the fried rice were cashews and pineapple chunks which added such a distinctive brightness to the rice. The dish was flawless. I would go here again and again just for that rice alone.  We also ordered the Sliced Beef and Vermicelli Noodle Soup with Bok Choy. This was a perfect entree for this cold fall night. It warmed you right up with subtle flavors of cilantro and bean sprouts in a delicious beef broth. The beef came out at a perfect temp and was very tender. They definitely don't skimp out of flavors and ingredients. My family and I will def be back soon to enjoy another warm winter favorite!

oBHVvdeW6AI36ffXfB1weg.text: I should have taken the warning when the lady who took my order told me the chef special soup was not  very good and she told me it smells badly. Pad Thai was fairly Americanized, but good. Curry duck was very good, calamari was a small portion and very rubbery. Coconut soup was over powered by excessive accents of lemon grass, which is too tough to eat, and had something that had the smell of cedar, texture of cedar, and looked like expired ginger root. I wouldn't recommend it (#19). The fried ice cream was a small portion, but not bad... pretty typical. There's several Thai restaurants nearby with similar pricing and fresher food. I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai. Pretty decent.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried rubber aka calamari

lBFKsgWTKT-jRZ-VUJFXIA.text: BEST noodles I've ever had! This is my new go-to place for my noodle cravings! And super friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton seafood with thin rice noodles. YES!

JYHc-7fEmD-SnDegy8YR-Q.text: Went here because of the reviews.  Normally go to David Wongs whenever I crave fried rice.  But since he went on vacation, I needed to find an alternative.  Went here with friends, knowing up front that service was subpar, but also expected the food to make up for it.  The consensus between friends is that this place deserves 1 star because the food doesn't come anywhere close to our favorite spot.  And the service was lack luster.    I encourage anyone who thinks this place is the bomb, give David Wong's 1 chance.  You will thank me later.

5_Omn7FnoYDg6GHA_t_u5Q.text: Found on Yelp and the reviews are right. Very good Thai food with an extensive but not expensive menu. Fast service considering how busy they were. Lots of take out, lots of full tables and lots of Asians eating here.

VO1H5Y5Pe05TNj_f3OfsCg.text: Everything is so delicious! They have a pretty large menu so you will forsure find something for you. They even have a vegan menu! I recommend their pad Thai and crispy tofu appetizer!

HmdMkKNv8aAUzUB8ozQOxg.text: I ordered for the first time and chose the pad thai thinking it would be the safe choice. I didn't think it was all that great. It was edible but I wouldn't want to order from here again

2PdFcdQLsK5DuLu16auo7A.text: Great food and great staff , I have been coming here since it opened and each time the food and service has always  been great . There was a time I ordered to go and they said it would be finished in 15 minutes but couldn't get there till almost 35 minutes later but when I got there they told me they remade my food because it was getting cold , thats probably one of the first time a restaurant has ever done that for me haha . But anyways the staff is friendly and the food / portions are great . One thing I would suggest is getting new furniture or maybe new seats because the seats are starting to look a little gross but besides that great over all 5/5

lKTnKX9-fQs6rz6TqRnBzA.text: After going to another Thai Restaurant and paying $12 for Pineapple Fried Rice, I was shocked with how cheap the prices were here. Around $7 for a big box of my favorite fried rice, and it tastes amazing? What more could you possibly ask for?  While I'm still a little weary to try other menu items, I did order the Mango Sticky Rice after reading a few good things about it here on yelp -- and it's actually really, really good. I was a little afraid how rice and fruit would mesh together, but it's tasty without being too sweet.  Clean looking restaurant, great tasting food, and I love how inexpensive it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget to say bye to Victor!

eb2J55g_vA-o7ghH0BUVfQ.text: This is great Thai food at a great price! Wonderful yellow and green curry! We also really like the house specialty potsticker appetizers. They deliver, which is also awesome! Just discovered it last week and already been back midweek for take out. :)

4AOff55MZQT3pkCi65PflQ.text: Delicious Beef Pad Thai! Their staff is always so nice! The Crab Rangoons are also delicious!

yDntNZJilF5cpxru8cm37Q.text: Really good curry. Second time I have been here. First time I got a red curry and second green curry.

tUwaxDa6DiDl1BhMKfkobQ.text: First time here and was not disappointed. Started with tom yum soup, bowl is huge and we shared it easily without finishing. Soup was tasty, spicy and full of shrimp. Only complaint was there was something hard in it. I think it was bamboo but whatever it was it wasn't edible. My wife had the curry chicken and I had the Thai spicy noodle. Funny story, my wife doesn't like real hot food, so she told them a "2" on the spice level, I love spicy so I said medium spice. My wife's food was so hot she was pink and sweating, while mine had a hint of spice but was not hot at all. Both were very good, we'll definitely go back, but be careful on the spice level, not sure how they interpret what you tell them. I washed it down with a couple Thai iced teas and they were fabulous. Service was good, prices very reasonable

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sv0qXeyY8oDQG6Z0_6lIcQ.text: I always order from here when I'm hungover lol I get usually a mix of things. But I always, always get the beef salad level 7! My favorite!!!

x399YwVeUcWf2ukWSWvfgw.text: One of our favorite Thai restaurants. Pin Kaow is our top choice, but we go to this place more often. Food is tasty, and portions are good.   I can highly recommend Thai Style Noodle House, and we've tried 3 of their locations and the food is consistently good.

94RLVmw8AjWFViYtTlTMDw.text: Food was great! I always order shrimp fried rice, mootod and combination noodles. I dont mind the customer service as long as they serve my food on time. The price is also right on the budget.

IpTEM2F5KAqXhiQaia2Crw.text: Nice little hole in the wall with delicious and authentic Thai food. How do I know it's authentic? My bf and I usually get the runs - IN A GOOD WAY because of the spice, not because of food poisoning, lol. Everything is incredibly affordable and well portioned with noodle dishes around $7 and specials around $8-9. I particularly enjoyed their special beef noodle soup, kuay kai seafood rice noodles, BBQ pork w/ papaya salad and sticky rice, and their pork larb. I would definitely stop by again if I'm ever in the area.

Z2YPE91X46Vsh3yzWIpimg.text: Food here is good.  Sometimes the food is a little off though when you tell them the spice level you want.  If you order a 4 spice level one day may be like a level 7 spice level another.   All in All, I just like their duck dishes and the beef noodle soups.  You can't really get it at some of the other Thai places.  If you're not a duck person or a Thai noodle soup person, then I would try places like Archi Thai's Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice is way better.

YZABIiNrEssrjA8vS3My8w.text: They have the best fried rice ever and the best thai tea!!! Will come here no matter the distance.

40izIvfij1lSHr-IpbxspA.text: Just moved to this side of town and was wanting some Thai food.    This place happened to be right across the street so gave it a go.  Glad we did.    Been there multiple times now.  Great food. Great prices.  Friendly service.

0DbqTwuYo4boy7jYgubHaA.text: I was so excited to try their food, ordered for carryout, they verified my order when I picked it up but I got home and they made my tofu pad see ew with chicken.:( Dinner was ruined as I don't eat meat. Will not be going back.

ArVrGdoWEJyucau_BNoyWg.text: Ordered from here tonight. The Thai food was good. We ordered the classics. One thing I was disappointed about was the pineapple fried rice. It was so spicy we couldn't eat it. I know what your thinking! But I'm from the south and I eat Thai food on the regular so I can handle some heat. We decided to go with 5/10. It was a mistake. It was our first time we ordered from here . And we will order from here again. Glad I ordered 2 Thai Teas.

lsZrXJ2kW0vNSRkMFjSQDQ.text: The place has great customer service and is clean with a nice set up and theme to.i really love there pad see .Staffs are awesome.The price is good and affordable.

Xr-6XYs3CyR0-1Ns5zbhUw.text: Quality Thai food at a reasonable price. I love their pad Thai and Thai tea! Very authentic tasting! I would totally recommend to anyone seeking Thai food!

m3YD4zrybklP_KNqWoJpng.text: I wish they would deliver to Spanish trails... but they dont... but again this is our go to Thai curry place... amazing food and always consistent, crab ragoons and red curry is always a winner!

148De5yejXLuvX4h1t31gg.text: Being a huge fan of Thai cuisine I was looking forward to trying Thai Style Noodle house.   I unfortunately was not impressed at all. My order consisted of chicken satay, crab Rangoon and pad Thai chicken spicy.   The chicken satay was made of chicken that had the texture of cardboard and was bland. The peanut sauce didn't do the satay any favors either. The crab Rangoon was ok, nothing special about it nor can I say it wasn't good. The sweat and sour sauce that came with it was watery. The main dish, the pad Thai chicken was mediocre. There is a distinct difference in pad Thai from a Chinese restaurant and pad Thai noodles from an authentic Thai restaurant, these favored Chinese, which was very disappointing. The spicy was rather weak and the chicken in the dish also had a cardboard taste.  Unfortunately, I would not return nor recommend this restaurant. On a positive, the host and server was very friendly!

KMjj9zC9IizWS_dbfeCVXg.text: We've eaten here multiple times! The chicken pad Thai is to die for!!! The mild is a little spicy but it is so good! We also get the Gyoza and it is perfection! They are not the regular "dip in sauce" gyozas. They have sauce drizzled over the top of them and it just makes the whole meal!   We had it delivered for the first time tonight and my mans exact words were "he loves his job!" The delivery driver was happy and got the food to us in great condition! Warm and all in place! We love the Thai House!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pad Thai!!! So good!

BtrJOJjWxBSAOlzzcOLl_A.text: My roomie and I walked in around 3pm on a Friday afternoon. We were told we could choose our own seating, cool.  I ordered the Hot and Sour special soup with flat noodles. My roomie ordered the spicy basil fried rice with beef. The Hot and Sour soup was not as flavorful as I had thought it would be. It was definitely sour, though. The soup comes with multiple meats but my favorites were the ground chicken and pork (everything else was eh). I'm giving this place 4 stars because I ended up enjoying my roomie's fried rice more than I liked my own meal.   Maybe next time I'll try something different. Will come back with hopes to be proven wrong about future dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum special with flat noodles
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil

Jq6f_MAcGDWrw_HK9LGqzw.text: Good little impromptu stop for Thai food! My friend got pumpkin curry and I got chicken pad Thai. Mine was delicious but on the spicy side for my English pallet. They gave me a free Thai iced tea to sooth my mouth which was not necessary but very thoughtful. My friend very much enjoyed her dish and that says a lot as a vegan curry connoisseur. We will be back! And I will ask for less hot haha!!

BlcVxvN0kbdgHdb1ARuOCw.text: This place is amazing.  We got the yellow chicken curry and pad Thai with beef shrimp and vegetable.   It's family owned business with wonderful service. I wish there there was more family owned places in town.

7kPBjnfj_6AgchWZsdwlSw.text: Great authentic food, with more then reasonable prices, service isn't the very best but food definitely makes up for it!

5g4GccqPLbdpTRcFh9EoPQ.text: I've been ordering from Thai Style Noodle House for a few years. Great prices and delicious.  I've tried several different Thai spots and always end up back here. For those customers that are reviewing and complaining yet frequent the business- maybe you shouldn't be so harsh and judgmental. You keep coming back for a reason so let's give them some credit.

GT8DnQi_adByEy6ZD3G3Ag.text: I love their salmon and avocado dish! And they serve mango sticky rice, however; I was a little disappointed because the rice was undercooked.

WifKk386zGMrZNvWxkZhhQ.text: My favorite location for the Thai style noodle house establishment. The food is always good for the price. The servers are usually polite and seem happy when my wife and I walk in. At first, I didn't like their rad na, but now I really like it! I also order the 3 companion and my wife always orders the khua khai.

6puECC1qMCz1LAICTktqMA.text: Just as good as the first one. I'm glad this place is the same because nothing needs to change. I love coming here for a quick bite to eat because I'm never disappointed and the service is relatively quick. And their Thai Tea is still on point. As with the original Noodle House, I wish it were a little bigger. I've never seen the place crowded or have a wait but I just feel a little cramped whenever I'm inside. I guess they're just keeping it old school.

Jkcr19SexaulTqHVuCFxtA.text: Came here based on it's Yelp score. We were at Lowes and wanted something cheap and Thai. We were not let down. Had the green salad (best peanut dressing) pad Thai and panang curry. All delicious! And all for only $23. Don't live near here but will be back! Service is adequate but not stellar, but who cares when the food is delicious!

3SVhIniZ0i2bph4YLQN8_Q.text: The food is good but the service is always terrible. Beef and basil should not have oyster sauce in it and charging $2 for meat ball for my choice of meat is utterly ridiculous! I've been to all the locations and the service is the same. Usually Thai people are nice, courteous and eager to please but not here or the Jones location. The original one in Chinatown was the best.

j9FYHAyDF5WvZlrUh8Nkow.text: Yellow curry and coconut juice was amazing! We'll be back very soon. Our server was kinda mean but the food made up for it!

SHcjUJdZHRcjNz0CGCo95Q.text: Very good food for a great price. I had the fried chicken over fried rice. The chicken was not overly oily, crispy delicious coating. The Orange chicken was great too, no chunks of fat or chewy pieces. Great quality of food and friendly service!

Arkofk9ceIB--FoO6PObSg.text: What can I say?  Great thai food and great prices.  I ordered the pad kee mao, papaya salad, and the spicy basil beef/ chicken.  Friendly people and I am so glad they are opening another one up on Jones and Warm springs!  Win!  I love this place and for the price, it's a must try.

IVvK2xBHG2rAV-SSskBbfw.text: We come here all the time mostly because it's right by the house and it's reasonably priced! Staff is so nice and food is served so quickly! Our favorites are beef nam tok, pineapple shrimp curry, panang, papaya salad and tom yum.

AtITVcfjmIkArZkYTCFPcg.text: Really good food for the price. Not overly greasy, which is always my worry with noodle dishes. We got chicken pad thai and beef pad se ew and both were worth every cent. I recommend!

Dex2ufaKR-O6CHb-5JX1_A.text: Have been here many times. I will never be back after the amount of time taken and no care if you wait. There were four people eating and I was the only person waiting. Soup took 30 minutes. When I expressed my concern no one cared. I DO NOT recommend. Zero stars in my book but you have to pick something.

y6kcfJGtMXdhec0SJE8DUw.text: Okay I travel a lot and this place is one of the best I have been to. The price is outstanding and this place is worth the drive away from the strip. Go for it!

eHk4PNSvsfdXIR4MZx69yA.text: Plenty of parking.  The place was clean.  Server was quick, friendly, and helpful.  We ordered silver noodle salad, pad see ew, and spicy string beans.  The food came out quickly.  It was well flavored and the ingredients were fresh.  The pad see ew was not overly sweet.  The total bill was around $21.  It was really good, but did not stand out as "Best I've Ever Had".  I would recommend it if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Silver noodles salad, my portion only
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad saw ew

OjB6NHMxRxJaS0BaYapYsg.text: Stopped by after getting a foot massage, which made me starving. It wasn't bad. The service was good. I have mixed feelings about the food. I got the yellow curry with chicken. It was really good, especially the potatoes in it. It was almost if they baked these pieces and then put them in the curry. They were different and tasty. I also got Som Tum and pork. This was just OK, especially the meat, which was a bit on the dry side and tasting slightly like liver. It came with two sauces and I preferred the one with vinegar rather than the sweet one although I'm not a big fan of vinegary tastes. The sticky rice that came with it was bad. It came in a bamboo container, I guess, to keep it moist. However, it was so tough, especially around the edges, that I didn't like it. I don't think it was supposed to be like this and that it was overcooked. I also didn't care for the bean-sprout type of salad. I'm not a fan of bean sprouts or having peanuts used in foods.

va5ZKHapQhh_PpiZ_UKK9A.text: We had a very nice dinner last night with my family. What I like about their food is it's not oily/greasy compared to other Thai resto. I gave it 4stars because 1st-high chair's strap is broken. I asked for another one but the server said all are broken. 2nd-plates & utensils need some upgrade. But other than those, their food is worth coming back for.

3-9uelxvtmy-3EVJ2PODsg.text: We eat here quite often. We love the food and the friendly service. We first went to  Noodle House 1 in China Town before 2 opened. This location is more modern and the room has a more fresh feel.  We love the lunch special menu, the pot stickers, the wonton fishball soup, the mixed veg entree. It's all very good. We have never been disappointed.

EeMgfPBBAZEYfpkfLhb5mg.text: Who's guilty of eating at one restaurant too many time?? This guy! I hate it when I get into these kind of cravings. TSNH makes it so easy for you to fall into this trap. Everything is dirt cheap and addictive.  I can say that dollar for dollar, this place makes the best Thai style steak salad in America. Is that too bold of a statement? Maybe. But for under $8, nothing can taste more amazing.  See, I'm in a good mood so I wrote a 5 star review, but like any restaurant you visit frequently enough, consistency can be their downfall. 4-5 stars based on the chef working there that day.  Another thing to point out is the level of spiciness 1-10.  But that's not their fault, it's our fickle diners. That's why I vote for a Universal Spiciness Barometer.  We need Thai style reform. We need to start here.

yhtti4gvXF_Vixad-M3rgQ.text: You get what you pay for. If you're looking for a cheap Thai Spot here you go! Bright side is they offer XL Thai Tea for $3.

VGCJf2OstNyW1M2T5FTVtg.text: Great place, great food.  Can make anything Vegan but you have to tell them.  They use a special button on cpu that says vegan.  I like that.  Means no fish sauce and egg.  Very nice, comfortable dining area.  Fast and friendly.

ABfWMwkutmsoObFF-Hx4tQ.text: The foods are so good , I ordered 2 chicken satay super yummy, and the price is so cheap, so 5 stars.i will be back

NHxhpfPQBI-uMvdIgA-BDQ.text: I go here for work lunches all the time. They are quick and the food  is delicious. There are a few options for Thai food in close proximity and this is my favorite.

PZ0FCM6WMQGp7AA1P0D1TA.text: ***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 27/100***  I come here for the affordable price point and good food. Though it isn't the best Thai food I've ever had, it's enough to satisfy any pesky cravings and in my humble opinion they have the best sticky rice and mango dessert. I'm a sucker for those things so I always order it no matter which Thai place I go to. It is not a complicated dessert and I've even made it myself a few times before but there's something about TSNH's version that makes it irresistibly good and so hard to stay away from. Another favorite is the Tom Kah Kai, it's a delicious soup with your choice of meat, it has mushrooms, lemon grass, tomato and has a coconut milk base. It's sooo good and depending on your heat tolerance they can customize the spiciness. It goes for most of their dishes like any other restaurant would. The pad thai is worth ordering as well. The kids really enjoyed their orange chicken and the hubby likes the fried rice with a side order of fried chicken. I have yet to try their curry but I'm confident I'll enjoy it like I do the rest of their offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fave! Sticky rice with mango.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha soup with chicken
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai basil chicken

5jxgKwVCgqdAuvf07S3vLg.text: Good Thai food on the cheap. The only thing I dont like is their chairs at the Fort Apache location. They are worn out and sunken in. Very uncomfortable.

6AWWSRnBulm5lz1MiPkLTw.text: Excellent fast Thai food! Great fresh flavors, very friendly staff & perfectly priced! Can't ask for more ham that~Yummy

A-eS4k13g8WqA841Al5wLQ.text: Been a while since we were in.  Cannot recall the last time, but things have changed.  The menu for one, it's not the same. Now I hear they have a new location.    We made our usual selections, started with a yellow curry.  Chicken, the pieces were tender, the veggies, onion, potato, bell pepper, cut just the right size, and the curry, not to overwhelming with coconut milk, pretty good.   I love eggplant and to please me, we ordered the spicy eggplant.  The eggplant is sauteed and is cooked well, there is a little hint of basil and thai chile, so not too spicy.    And finally we got a noodle, I don't remember the name, it was a flat Noodle and came with chicken, egg, green onion and bean sprouts.  it was good.

EwwfxjltyufxpL8mIlKJGg.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant at this time! Great prices, food has amazing flavor and the portions are on point. Definitely a go to when you're in the mood for Thai food!

mciNa7NJyepjWcse7meFMQ.text: I love love love this place. If they were closer to my house I would probably frequent this place more then once a week.  It's hard to find a good Thai place that cooks their food like my moms style but here they do and I struck gold because my mom now lives in Tennessee so this was the best substitute.   Every time I come here I want to order everything on the menu but always get the Crispy Pork belly fat with Chinese broccoli about $8.95 plus a single side of rice. Their 3 companion dish hits close to home with the BBQ pork, papaya salad and sticky rice is perfect and reminds me of what my mom would make all the time. A lot of their other dishes are absolutely delicious and the dessert sound and looks amazing I yet have to try that.   Food is amazing, price is awesome and restaurant is clean and quaint. The staff is also very nice. I would return to the place everyday of I could. If you haven't been here you must do just that because you will be hook at first bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish sauce with Thai chili and line sauce is a must when ordering the crispy pork with chinese broccoli
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite Crispy Pork Belly Fat with Chinese broccoli stir fry $8.95 comes with a side of rice.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung Pao chicken place...so very good about $8

9p6XhQ7-dNzCMLmyyF7lVQ.text: Hands down the best Thai food in Vegas. The service was on point, the place is clean and again the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best!

bDrhBtkv1VyMO7G_AZX97w.text: Most recent visit was disorganised and disappointing. The food here is tasty but the portion size for the price is daylight robbery. First time having my favorite Glass noodle salad here but it was overly salty and had barely any noodles, mostly cilantro, onions and romaine. This dish is bigger AND better at Panna down the street. Our waitress was rushing us to order even though there was only one other table. Then our main dishes came out separately so two of us were eating while the others were still sitting 20 mins without food. We asked to cancel the orders because it was taking too long and we had to get back. The waitress kept telling us the food was almost ready but we'd lost our appetite and our time at this point. She was quick to take our payment however. Smh.

7-9L_F_ZGnebjwiP_PAhwg.text: So this place is really close to the house. It's a really  small place that's family oriented. The people were friendly and attentive. First time being here and will definitely will be returning. They have great take out available and you also get it delivered.

0kw4KXFijPJc5a6k2zkSig.text: I've never eaten anything from here that I don't like. This place is amazing. The service is great and the staff is always friendly and willing to answer any questions. The food is absolutely delicious, I recommend the seafood tom yum soup or the spicy eggplant.

19yRa3enURmdreRtCqOaXQ.text: If you're looking for something cheap and decent, this place isn't bad. We ordered fried tofu, calamari, duck curry, salmon avocado curry, chicken noodles. We all asked for medium spicy and most of our food wasn't spicy at all except for the noodles which was really spicy  ( my friend looked like he was in a hot yoga class while eating it, I personal tried it and it was on the very spicy side) we had to add rice to it and even with that, it was still very spicy.

AKVgwpikqDLAbFEScvEFDQ.text: Love their food! Their prices are also incredibly low for the quality of the food. Highly recommend!

x5U7QpL5cT5Lb6zPY9_hCQ.text: All you need is one dish, DUCK FRIED RICE! I usually go to the original location but this place is a lot nicer and bigger. Flat white noodles compare to other places taste about the same.  I give it 5 stars because for the price you're getting pretty good food.

eqMuS0hmKa41kxCmxnor8g.text: I love this Thai style noodle house the best. They are always on point with their flavor! I love the ambiance of the location better as well. It is not as bright, and the decoration is well done. The waitress always gets my order right and they make the best Thai tea. I ordered to go for the first time and I think I will stick with eating in!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean inside
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai extra tofu

75UP-sTCsAecO1ivLwrM9w.text: The very first place I came to eat at when I first moved to Las Vegas.  I was impressed by the quality of food, and service.  I have come here numerous time over the past few months.  My favorite dish is the Yellow Curry, and I think their coconut juice is some of the best I've ever tasted (ice cold, served with a spoon to eat the baby coconut).

CAlIz3RCYggKLstVd_7q1A.text: Only giving it 2 stars because of the service. Food is always good here, but this was the first time we dined inside. We arrived around 9:20p and the place closes at 10p. There was 2 other tables in the restaurant when we arrived. When we sat down they gave us 2 minutes to look at the menu and asked if we were ready and we asked for another minute. An older lady approached us twice after that asking if were ready and the second time around she said kitchen is closing so we have to order. We ordered 2 apps and 2 entrees. Entrees came out first and then the apps. You could tell they were rushing. After we got all the food they immediately dropped the check. She made a comment "take your time" so we tried to finish eating and they kept stopping by to see if the check was ready. When my boyfriend gave her his card she dropped the check back off and said "sign it so I can close it out." Overall the food was good but the service was rude. 7/1 dine in date & there was 1 older & 1 younger woman working. Should close at 9:30 if you're going to rush the kitchen but you say you close at 10.

aS3-mqDHId9CrHUxWd1B1g.text: This place was sooooo amazing and inexpensive! My boyfriend actually recommended this place for their potstickers (which were a mouthgasm).  The service was okay. We went in on New Years Day and they forgot a few essential things like hot sauce, napkins, extra bowls, and even plates.... Haha but it's okay! The food totally made up for it.  We ordered the seafood soup with rice noodles, basil beef, chicken satay (on the tiny side) everything tasted fantastic and the price I paid was unbelievablely reasonable and way cheaper than any other thaifood place. Good prices and high quality food. I can't wait to come back :)

YonB41ikHMlapReuHhi5tw.text: Love love love this place! I always get their Shrimp Pad Thai at level 5! Such a good portion just wish they would add more peanut crumbs!

i7FRlsGCQtlzJurd7GPE9Q.text: This a great spot for very reasonable prices and good sized portions. I had the pumpkin chicken curry which was delicate and flavored well and really good. My hubby had the spicy basil beef with wide pan fried noodles, which was good, but not as flavorful as mine. We split an order of chicken satay, which we both thought was over-seasoned and the peanut sauce lacking in flavor. I think we'll try again as the curry was so delicious. We asked for it spicy... a 7 of  10 for me i thought it was more of a 5... so kind of americanized. We thought it really worked if you were in the mood for thai, in a hurry and cheap eats.

nO81DK5UMOF11-wBsAXsxw.text: I'm giving it 2 stars for the service and quickness. Now for the food, we ordered the pad Thai and the pad se ew. The pad thai was a big clump of sticky gummy ramen like noodles you could barely chew let alone swallow, but the flavor was good they need a flatter noodle and the chicken was over cooked. The pad se ew had good flavor but the noodles were not wide the pork was tough.  I prefer the food at the corner Thai kitchen around the corner on trop.  Give it a try and please let me know what you think.  I jugde a Thai place on the pad Thai if they can make that well, you can bet the rest will be good too.

pP0PMLA1pQo05FEcK8YyTg.text: This location has better decor and furniture.  However, the food is okay.  Not that delicious.  The portions was a lot smaller than the original location on Wynn st. The service was not great either.  My bf and I ordered Tom Yum Noodle soup, and pad thai noodle.  The tom yum noodle was a lot smaller, and the pad thai was good but it did not have lime (like wtf right?). The thing that killed my experience was the poor service.  The whole time it was very difficult to get a hold of the waiter even though there were a total of three parties at the restaurant.  I would not recommend any one driving that far to this location for thai food.

7vp7AUpZGsb6jbGebBk_5w.text: Food was alright.  I didn't like the mayo sauce they put on the pot stickers. Service was ok. Everyone was very friendly.

db9Lmtlg7yZGXdo0d9fJ2Q.text: I usually don't eat at Thai Restaurants because everything is so sweeeeet and I can make it better at home.  But today, I tried TSNH and it was actually very good.  I did have to tell them to hold the sugar on everything.  I ordered Rad-na because I do not like to make this particular dish because it's too much work for me. My daughter had Spicy basil fried rice and (hold the sugar please!!)  it turned out delicious.  We will be going back as this place is pretty tasty!!!

AMgyCFPGEIxuZLUn2Jkdcw.text: Delicious, cheerful and cheap!  The duck noodle soup with vermicelli noodles was absolutely fabulous and great value at $6.75.  Green beans with tofu was also very good too.  The green beans were crisp, which means they were fresh not frozen and the red spicy sauce was yummy.  The veggie spring rolls were fresh and crisp.  The waitress was very friendly and helpful and even suggested a variety of condiments for my dishes!  My only wish is for this establishment to open in YVR, because I would be a regular for sure!

rUtoRTmYcnVHztsTjDQY6Q.text: I had this place bookmarked for a while and decided to stop by for lunch today. I arrived at 1:55 to find out they do lunch til 4....pretty cool! They have a lunch menu and a vegetarian/vegan menu. I choose the vegetarian menu. So much to choose from. Soups and salads, rice and noodle dishes. I got the spicy basil noodle. I asked for extra broccoli and extra thai basil. I also got a thai iced tea. I'm not usually a fan but the past 2 times I went out I ordered the thai tea and enjoyed it. The dish was good. I happen to like Pan Asian's a little better. PA's has some sort of Thai spice on the dish that is wonderul. I dont know what it is though. I'm going to come back and try a few other things. Id like to try the pineapple rice and the yellow curry. The service was good, although it did seem to take quite a bit for my meal to come out. It was hot and delicious though, and that's important. The price was A-OK for me too!
