TTsupSWefZcUI1-8JwNfow.text: Went down to american shooters to check out some ARs and got hungry. so drove to thai style noodle to get some food. the inside is pretty small, maybe seats 20 people max. the food here is super cheap!! a bowl of noodles is about = $6 and a thai ice tea is $1.50ish. i ordered potstickers, a bowl of duck meat noodles and a bowl of bbq pork noodles. the potstickers were really crispy but they put too much of the mayo sauce on top so its like eating a potsticker sushi roll. the duck noodle was ok the broth tasted good not too salty a little dark and cloudy though. the worst was the bbq pork noodles. the pork was dry as hell and the broth had NO taste whatsover. overall for the price everything was OK. i would go back and get something else to try.

fRxBK3YDpaLw8vwju3THJQ.text: Basil Fried Rice. Get it. It's my favorite thing on the menu because it's freaking delicious. I get take out and have never dined in so I'm not too familiar with their customer service, but as far as I can tell it coincides with other Asian restaurants if you know what I mean. last time I finally tried their soups and not too shabby! I'd highly recommend their soups. easy substitute for Pho for those days when you're craving something hot and delicious and possibly help with your hangover or get over a cold.

4eHG9VWZXM_oUaQquf8aAQ.text: Cheap, fast and tasty - and you don't have to settle for two out of three.  We had duck noodle soup (I didn't get a taste, my daughter became quite defensive after her first bite), orange chicken and red curry with pumpkin and chicken.  Orange chicken was the bomb!  Tangy, crispy, and light - the breading enhanced the flavor rather than acting as filler.  Red curry was marvelous, with carrots, green pepper and basil.  I've had a lot of Thai curries and this was one of the better ones - light on the coconut milk, nice variety of textures and flavor.  I ordered it medium hot which was right for me and I eat spicy food.  I suspect the hot would be very hot.  Only criticisms are that the orange chicken was simply chicken and rice, it would have been nice to see a bit of garnish with carrot.  And they didn't offer condiments, which I suspect we could have gotten if we'd asked, but the food didn't need it.

6gYzbiprrPthxLm6svhyog.text: Fantastic lunch.  Excellent value.  Nice people.  The green curry pork truly hit the spot.  I've been to Thailand more frequently than to Reno, so I can wholeheartedly endorse this spot.  The dinner menu is quite standard with a few additional 'Chinese-style' dishes.  Beef Broccoli?  Sure.  Why not?  Next time is the acid test - Phad Thai and Tom Kar Gai.  If these pass muster, I'll be a frequent visitor.  Great find!  Thanks, Yelp.

DHL_SDVXiSvj6dACpkwKkg.text: Usually when I come here I get their Egg fried rice! This location has great flavors on a dish that is SO basic!   Also when it's under 5 dollars for a whole 2-4 servings of it, it's a steal!

gMfOn-ypiT9xD8lrwI7c9g.text: Tons of restaurants around so it's easy to miss this one in the middle. I'd say it's a hidden gem. We came with a large group and they were quick to accommodate all 15 of us. It was a large order with tons of food and all in all didn't take too long time come out. We got the shrimp avocado panang and pad see yew. The curry was pretty good! It also comes with rice so you didn't have to order a side. The pad see yew was a little too sweet for my liking, but still good. Their scale is interesting because it goes from 1 to 10. Pictures really sold us on the sticky rice with mango. I'm also a big fan of fried ice cream so I had to get that too. Both were quite good and I was glad I got both. The mango isn't quite in season but it was still tasty. The warm sticky rice was delicious! If I came back, I'd get the duck fried rice. Our friend had that and it was really really good. Overall, a really nice visit! Plus the prices were really cheap compared to places back home.

Yuh5AUdRIrYj02yBINORrQ.text: Unfortunately, I have to downgrade my review from 5 to 2 stars after a recent bad experience. I've always liked their orange chicken and typically order it, it's lightly fried, crispy white meat with no nasty gristly parts like most Chinese/Thai places have. It may have just been an off night, but I ordered the chicken and it seemed like the regular kitchen staff took the night off and hired Stevie Wonder to stand in. The chicken was chewy, tough and even looked completely different that I was used to. Small, dry pieces. It was pretty gross. Even the chicken noodle soup was off, it wasn't as taste as it usually is. I was turned off after that, I tossed the food and probably won't be back. There's a million Thai places with good reviews in Vegas, time to change it up.

zXCjDjQRSNpAiIehli4ePA.text: The staff is so friendly and there is so much to try. I had the chicken pad Thai and the chicken satays. Both were so good, I've had to go back multiple times.

C_rY0JwrDcUvcA6ca5CEzA.text: Lent season = no meat. So what better place to grab shrimp dishes than a thai spot?   And while I may opt for all the standard staple Thai dishes, I can also be very picky about them... and I was very impressed that they are all done very well at this 4 locationed restaurant throughout Las Vegas (Chinatown, Fort Apache, Rampart & S. Jones)!  RECOMMEND:  - TOFU PAD THAI: Stir fried small rice noodles with egg, ground peanuts, bean sprouts in pad thai sauce. (I ordinarily would order this with chicken, if I could eat meat!) - SHRIMP YELLOW CURRY: Coconut milk mixed with white onions, bell peppers, tomatoes & potatoes, with side of white rice.  - SHRIMP PAD SEW: Stir fried flat rice noodles and egg with broccoli in sweet black soy sauce. (I usually prefer this dish with beef, but like I said, lent no meat fridays!) - SEAFOOD WONTON SOUP: Wonton soup with seafood and yoo choy in clear broth. Add noodles to it for $0.75!   Everything extremely satisfactory and hit the spot! Service was good, venue was nice, and the portions were filling! New to the southwest area and I think we officially found our go-to Thai place! :)

3g7_qQJ1kagnzQjU-c_6Mg.text: I was in Vegas looking for a place to live and I hadn't eaten all day long. I was feeling for Thai food and happened upon this place. It is very unassuming, but inviting. I decided to have the Chicken Pad Thai and I asked for it to be  level spicy. The woman was skeptical but I assured her that as an island woman, I could take anything that she dished out.   The meal arrived after about 10 minutes, which was not too long to wait for someone eating alone. The portion was large enough that I could have split it into two if I wanted, always a plus. The pad Thai? It was fantastic. The seasoning, combined with the heat was just an explosion in my mouth! Definitely brought a smile to my face. The waiter kept staring at me to see if I could actually take the heat and I did! Ate every bite.  The only reason that I'm not giving the place a 5 star rating is because I thought there could be a bit more chicken, but the overall flavor more than made up for it. Oh and the meal was super affordable at $7.50.  This place will definitely be seeing me again when I move to Vegas!

rA-eiS-uku2Sb0E4I9ZVPg.text: We were out shopping and wanted something a little different and had a craving for some soup or noodles. We decided  on a combination. I had b\never heard of this place but saw many 4 star reviews on YELP so we stopped in. As you arrive you are quickly greeted and seated. There were quite a few people in here and their bowls looked amazing. Looks like we made a great decision. Drink orders quickly taken (I LIKE THIS). We then looked over menu and decided on shrimp rolls as an appetizer. Very good choice on this nicely rolled flavorful and crunchy. Josie got the Chicken Noodle Soup minus the Tofu. I ordered the Roasted Duck Noodle Soup. They bring the spice on the side so you can heat it as you please. The duck soup had a salty earthy flavor I added to small spoon fulls of the Thai spice in the bowl they gave me. That added the bit of heat I needed and wanted. Josie enjoyed the Chicken Noodle said it filled her and warmed her on a brisk day in wintery Vegas.   Everything here was on point. Service was excellent food was amazing. We will be back for the other Thai selections on this menu. If you are in area please try it you will not be disappointed.

8UCsvfBKS0n3KaCkhbMQtw.text: My go to place for authentic and delicious Thai food! This place is so good! I used to go to Archi's for thai food but after discovering Thai Style Noodle House, I have not stepped foot in the former. It's also a plus that this place is right next to my house. There is another Thai Style Noodle House location in chinatown but this one is about a 5-7 minute drive from my house. The portions are pretty generous for Thai food. If you eat a lot of Thai food, you'll know that the servings area always tiny. This place is the total opposite. The plates are always full and very affordable. ~$50 could feed my whole family (4) with left overs. Another reason I love this place is because it's very family oriented. Everyone here is really nice and they're always coming around to make sure everything is alright even though it's always packed when I go. It's nice to see how attentive they are, especially since their staff is very small.  My favorite dish here is the Pad See Eu with beef. MMM. I am salivating just thinking about it! A second favorite is the spicy eggplant with tofu. I usually get the spice level at a medium so it's not too overpowering. The duck fried rice is a good option too! Oh and don't forget the squid salad, potstickers, and last but not least... the mango sticky rice! It is absolutely AMAZING!! I could go on and on about the different food items that I love here. The only thing i wasn't a fan of here was their thai iced coffee and thai iced tea. They were good but a little too sweet for my taste. Not a big deal though. I can't wait to come back here for a feast!  Oh yeah, they also do delivery but I believe it's only within a 3 mile radius.

1iRBKC9uT71ed6id7GW0GQ.text: I have ordered delivery from this place on a number of occasions.  To be fair, I have never been inside the restaurant itself so I cannot meaningfully comment on restaurant atmosphere etc.  To that extent, I cannot give the review more than a four and speak accurately.  Delivery is very timely and the people are friendly over the telephone.  Our order was well packaged and came to the house hot and fresh.  I have tried number of the dishes here and never been disappointed.  The drunken noodles with seafood combination is a spicy and savory dish that hits the spot.  I am a big fan of the curries here.  The red curry with seafood combination and the duck curry are excellent as well.  The soups are very delicious and sooth the body well if one is feeling sick or under the weather.  The spice level is appropriate as to what we have requested.  This has consistently been a good delivery food experience.  I look forward to visiting the restaurant in person soon.

FC9CG4ohMhDLRTJV4VAENA.text: The basil chicken w rice, excellent! The pot stickers excellent! Thai tea good. . I love good thai. This was my first time here , I'll be back

euvmB1Rst0mSARBhTi5-Sg.text: GREAT CURRY! yummy pot stickers and pad thai. like the new location further from the strip.

ZC70pkujjj7gv9GPObE_gw.text: This place is great. We were in the area and my girll suggested we try this place for lunch. As an official fan of Thai food, I was on board. The curry and noodles were perfect. Delicious and spicy. My favorite combination. I will definitely be back and because of their great prices, I can often.

rDzbUN2PjpahbPhJB5Q7yA.text: Thai food is quick to cook...the technique takes longer to master!  Wouldn't recommend

IJ6xADwmKuw3CiUiecyz8A.text: Great place for a quick Thai fixin!  Love the friendly staff!  Kudos to Victor, La!  Always smiling, attentive, and friendly.  My fav dish is the "Chicken Noodle Soup with Flat noodles"

8BLc6NoLnEQMAsehTDQpvQ.text: We ordered the Won Ton Soup and Prak Pi King which is the name they used for spicy green beans. The soup comes with fish cakes, pieces of pork loin, garlic chips, cilantro and bean sprouts.Both dishes were so good!! Highly recommend this place. The Pad See Ew is excellent, and  the combination beef soup is tasty and full of flavor because they use three different kinds of beef. The broth is probably made with beef bones but is really heavy broth. I have yet to try the Tom Yum Soup noodle. Thai ice tea one of the best I've tried. Excellent customer service and pleasant servers.  Place is about to celebrate its first anniversay next week. They do a lot of take out orders and free delivery if you live less than 3 miles. Will be here every week for sure since we live close by.

5seVtgeigNMnrdbhqHJrGw.text: So my wife and I are big fans of the Thai Style Noodle House in Chinatown.  We just recently saw that there is one in our neighborhood.  In fact, it's five minutes away, ON THE SAME STREET!!! We were very excited, and decided on night to have some delivered.  That was mistake number 1 for us.  They said that it would be 25-30 minutes.  After 45 minutes, I called them and they said that the driver was just now leaving.  15 minutes later, the driver calls me and says he cannot find our apartment complex.  I told him exactly how to get to our place from the restaurant, and he tells me it's not right.  So after a little back and forth, I finally convince him that I know what I'm talking about, and he's on his way.  15 minutes later, he cannot find our apartment building, blah blah blah.  To top it all off, they didn't even get our order correct.  Long story short, I wouldn't order delivery from them again, but I would go pick up takeout.

DYrTbFkZtpNkz078dkSkmg.text: So I was very disappointed with TSNH especially when it had a 4 star rating.  But then again I noticed other having missed opinions about this place also.  I didn't have high expectations going in, since this was Plan B for dinner, so that's probably the only reason why I didn't give them a 1.  First off there was something wrong with the service, I don't know, it was the most MEH experience I've ever had.  The lady who served us only smiled once and this was when it was time to pay, as if she was only happy to see money. We all ordered water maybe that added to why we got that service.  The food we also received were complete opposites from what I've seen on the pics and what was described in the reviews.  One of the dish we ordered was the yellow curry.  The flavor in the curry was decent but there were very little ingredients.  It was mostly sauce and it was very watery.  Another dish we ordered was the chow mein, the noodles were dry and it was all very salty. And another was the fried chicken, HORRIBLE don't ever order this, it was rubbery and tiny like microwaved chicken.  I don't know maybe I went on bad night or they just sensed that this was my Plan B for dinner.  I probably won't be back.

30x14Q3uedDdLpYMM6zQCA.text: We had the sampler appetizer platter. The bbq chix skewers were.very good . I would def get that by itself next time. If there is. The rest were meh. We also had the pad see ew. That was also good although lacked any spice and some salt.. We asked for medium . We also got the beef larb. I ve eaten quite a bit of this dish at many Thai places and I also used to work at a Thai rest. Their larb is nothin. Like anything it's suppose to be. Maybe they forgot how to make it that night? It was just chopped up big chunks of beef . With some lemon juice. No mint no rice powder nothing . And mind u they threw so much red pepper flakes in it that I know for a fact they over spiced it . It had red all over . But they didn't correct it. Poor customer service on their end . I just didn't eat it.  The good : prices.  The bad: service and quality .

0BQmoXdBF9tVeo4bkJnDjA.text: Very good food, fast service, great prices. The Thai specialty drinks are cheaper than at other places. Nice inside, friendly service, no debit card limit of $15 anymore (great bc I don't carry cash).   My favorites are the papaya salad, basil fried rice, and pad Thai. I'll keep coming back happily! :)

9Nt0hmGeIbqzXkFNER1rzw.text: Always eat here with Co-workers for lunch but will never go back. We called to place a order and we decided to have it delivered. The lady taking the order was going to charge the two of us ordering separate delivery charges and had attitude when asked why! Never again will we eat here again, so disappointed..

7iEW-vzIcMw83VdtmPVEOQ.text: Whoa, how have I not reviewed this place?  I've checked in like 7 times!  Thai Style Noodle House 2 is pretty decent Thai food and pretty decent prices.  It's not my favorite Thai place in Las Vegas, but that doesn't stop me from frequenting this place.  Their curry selection is pretty cool.  They've got avocados and pumpkin in their curries, which reminds me of Pan Asia.  I've also sampled the pad thai and a yummy noodle dish that has chicken, tofu, shrimp, squid, and just a bit of everything in it.  Their garlic pork is very flavorful, and their spice levels are right on point.  I kept hearing about this beef jerky that they have, but I didn't like it.  Really tough and burnt.  The service is quick and friendly.  I definitely recommend this place to my Yelp friends!

lv2Zr4k-aboE4iHfhxWUQA.text: I have been here 10+ times. My wife is from Thailand and we love coming here! Great service and food prices are very resonable. The employees work hard and are polite. Im getting hungry thinking about the place :) If you get a thai tea make sure they give the bigger cup I got the smaller cup a couple times and was dissapointed. I highly recommend giving this place a try!

ZMvdV-n7mN26Q3FUzufO9Q.text: Decided to pick up some food from Thai Style since I was close by, and I have already tried the neighboring Thai spots (Panna Thai, Surang...).  -Tom Kha:  I ordered the 6 out of 10, but tasted more like an 8.  It was decent, but I liked this soup at Surang more. -Duck Curry: Again, I ordered 6 out of 10, but tasted like an 8...boy were we huffing and puffing.  It was hot.  There weren't many slices of duck in this curry.  It did came with a side of white rice. -Mango sticky rice:  I ordered two of these.  The sticky rice was yummy and it was covered with coconut milk.  It came with half of a "not in season" mango.   But for the price of $3.95 each, it was still a steal. -Thai tea:  quite strong.  I enjoyed the tea very much.  It was easy and quick for this to-go order, but there are many other Thai places out there...

vcoAtxyMF7owFtRLblZ6YA.text: Compare with another Thai Style Noodle House, which is right next to my house. The food at this one is just okay, I prefer their her one better. And when we enter there's a long line waiting. We waited for 20 minutes and finally made tout seat. The waitresses are good and bad depending on who's the server, we have 3 ladies serving us so the service is not consistent.  I'd rather go to the one near my house than this one for sure.

4uEgWp_SpItPYwOfDzzUsQ.text: This place is greeeeaat. They're place is pretty clean and the service for both at the store and delivering is awesome.  The only problem I had was I didn't know the green curry was THAT spicy, and I ordered a number 1. Which burnt my mouth extra bad.  N.H STYLE POT STICKERS WERE BOMB.

THSTRX-ldERiRk5SuCXIxg.text: The duck fried rice is always the bomb. Combination beef noodle was great!! No pics to post cause we devoured it already... Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qzsOFYVycoRwXu2O0NnL_A.text: This is my absolute favorite Thai restaurant in the southwest area.   [CUISINE] Khua Kai: My current favorite item on the menu. If you've never had it before its like a seared noodle dish with egg, served with a Thai sweet chili sauce. LOVE IT!   Three Companion: The pork had a charred, barbecue flavor, it was a little chewy, but it's pork.  Panang Avocado Curry: This used to be my favorite menu item, (I've ordered this about 20 times) but sadly something has changed either with the quality of the Salmon or the preparation of it. I would not recommend ordering it. The salmon is consistently bad quality or dry tasting.  I asked and they said there was no change. Tried it three more times before finally giving up on it.  [DECOR] I love the decor here. It's a very small cozy restaurant, there is this amazing faux tin ceiling which is my favorite thing about the decor here. I find myself looking up. I like that they pay Thai television here too. The walls have are half stone. Very beautiful in a casual environment.  [PRICE] Very good pricing. Main dishes are $7-$9 and very filing. :)  [SERVICE] Everyone is very sweet and friendly here :)

wMa0hBO4pJDY8Kdn-_l5ow.text: Casual, totally unpretentious - the place I go when I'm really hungry and I want hearty great Thai food at a great price.  Staff is friendly, and whatever I order, I'm never disappointed. Chet also serve a pumpkin curry that is to die for, and I don't see this item on menus of other Thai restaurants.  Hubbie agrees, we've never had a bad dish here.  And we've been here many times.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love everything here.  But this is one of my favorites.  And I don&#39;t see it on the menu elsewhere.

frLQiZQ2SI8AXiLx_yKF3A.text: The cashier was rude dont have no since of humor, I don't think he knows whats customer Service is all about. I wouldnt recommend this place at all...

hC3Zj3qaeQ_XI5FPp3dPvw.text: 5 stars even though in a strip center- why? It's all about the food and service. Fairly extensive menu caused worry about quality sacrifice. Ordered 4 different meals and everyone was really good without any repeating of style or flavor- served family style so all got  samples. Restaurant was not fancy but clean and tasteful. Service from Victor was excellent as he saw my parents unfamiliar with Thai dishes and took time to describe, ask about their taste preferences, but then tactfully left the table to our meals. All this including combo appetizer and one dessert (for Dad). Tab?......$50

LDJ05alMgokQmjScz2vBog.text: This was my first visit to this location for dinner on a Friday night.  They were located on S Ft Apache Rd/near W Hacienda Ave in Las Vegas.  I have been to the location in Chinatown for lunch.  My friend ordered the Red Pumpkin Curry.  The pumpkin looked like it had been browned or baked and then added to the curry.  The flavor was good.  This entree came out about 5 minutes before my entree.  I ordered the BBQ Pork Rice Plate which I would usually order in a Vietnamese restaurant.  It was brought out with a clear soup at the same time.  The soup could have at least been brought out with my friend's entree so I had something to eat while I was waiting for my food.  The BBQ Pork was thrown on top a pile of rice.  There was no pretty cucumber and carrot garnish.  The rice was not arranged in an appealing shape.  I'm a very visual person and I like to have food that looks good.  The service was almost non-existant.  I did not get a refill of water nor did the server ask if we needed anything after she brought me the Spicy Tray.  I don't know if I would go back.

EwWiNC-xQudkTRjW5AT6OQ.text: Went here for the first time last night with my boyfriend and his brother. I love Thai food, so I was excited to try a new place out.   The food was delicious. I had the Pineapple Curry Shrimp, but substituted the shrimp with chicken instead, which they had no issue with. My boyfriend had the Panang Curry. We also had the Chicken Satay and the Pad Thai with Beef to share. All of which was very tasteful. My only issue was they don't give nearly as much rice as I hoped they would. But, maybe that's just the Asian in me, ha.   The service, however, was subpar. It wasn't very busy when we got there - maybe three other tables. Our first waitress was nice, but quiet. Which isn't really an issue. She took our order for food and drinks and that was that. The second waitress who brought our food out, wasn't very welcoming - sort of had a "I don't really care" attitude. She gave my plate to my bf's brother, even after I said it was mine and vice versa. We also didn't get our drinks, until we asked again, and when the waitress brought them out, she swapped them around again. No big deal, but there were only three of us at the table.   Anyway, I'd come back for the food for sure, but definitely not for the service.

fbuOVIYemZs5sbmi4Mm3Hw.text: Two days in a row, we ate and ordered different food items and the taste is really great!  Authentic Thai food for a cheap price!  So worth it!

YKLNHviF8w1kTKm3QAmRNw.text: Very good find...thanks for previous yelpers as they were not wrong...  The Seafood Tom Yum with noodles was delicious and definitely hit the spot on this cold of a night.  Will be back for more!

8rFdmRXOqOaDGm8nGTvEYw.text: Good spot but their stuff is SPICY! I got the Tom Yum noodle soup, medium spicy and I was pretty much blowing my nose the entire time. I enjoy spicy but I don't want to drown in my own snot.   Definitely getting mild next time.

mckD5OFFJDVNtItblrp4kg.text: This is my most favorite spot to eat Thai! The cost is so affordable and everything I've eaten I've been happy with. The staff could be friendlier but all in all its great! I've taken a lot of friends and family members here and they all love it as well. We are extremely sad though that they've stopped their lunch specials!!! Super sad about that.

tBoC2EqAeniqpkL5zw7HRw.text: For the price, it's the best papaya salad I've had in town. Curry was a little pricey for the size (half quart) but it was still good. I asked for 7 spice on each and they were 2's at most. But it was quick, friendly and efficient.

LymqC6Ty7aaEVH4_km_BKA.text: Bad customer service. They were not attentive at all. Had to walk up to the counter for multiple things because they didn't not come to check on us except one time. We asked about their spice levels and they were completely off. We order spice level 3 and we were told that's spicy but in fact we tasted no spice. This place is not very clean at at. We asked them to clean the table twice and it was still first.  Bathrooms were nasty, floors were sticky. Food was ok for the price. We will not be going back though and we would not recommend this place. I have it 2 stars because price and taste.

FIWBfESqG529LNRcGOYJ1A.text: This place was pretty bad.  Ordered Mongolian beef and I got 5 piece of dry meat with ton of vegetables that I didn't want.

0T62t5R5CeItWYenTHHvEg.text: I love this place the servings and service is always on point ! Pho thack spicy 5 n Thai tea is heaven

33D3W36-V--CQbD5uw5S_A.text: I have literally been going to Thai Noodle House for years.  I have been to all of their locations many times.  In the past several months,  there have been weeks when I have gone multiple times.  Sadly to say because of the rude service I received from a bald server with glasses,  I will not be going to any of their locations again   We got there 02/02 at 11:57 am.  I had tried calling about 10 minutes before arriving for a takeout order.  First time,  no one answered.  Second time after at least 5 rings, an answer but told me to hold.  After three minutes no one got back on the line so I just hung up since I would be arriving shortly.   When I got there I immediately gave my order to the bald server since I didn't need a menu.  At this point there were two tables in the restaurant.  One with 3 people and one with 5 people.  Also there were two take outs being worked on I could see the orders on a wall clip.  There were two servers.   After a few minutes my kids and I walked outside to check out the other stores.  Then we came back and stood by the counter.  I think my kids blocked the bald server's way since he was walking back to the kitchen and said that the food was not ready and we could have a seat.   (Although he could have just walked around a table to get to the kitchen. ) My kids just sat down and I said "oops sorry".  At about 12:13, to go food came out from the kitchen which could have been ours.  The bald server was doing something else at the counter so he didn't check on the food that just came out. At this time another customer came in to pick up his order.  The bald server explained it wasn't ready.   Instead of working on the takeouts so they wouldn't get cold,  he then chose to ask the customer who just came in,  to pay for the order that wasn't yet ready.  Then he checked on the food that came out.    As he was doing this,  I could see that only one of the dishes was ours...a noodle soup dish that had beenawwww sitting there.  A few minutes later I saw our first come out.  He was busy doing something so I just asked,  "Excuse me,  I think that's our order."  He looked at me,  turned around to look at the food,  turned to me half smirked and didn't say anything.  A couple minutes later he went and got our second dish. When he was bagging the items,  he did ask if I wanted any chili.  I responded, some crushed chili please.  He then dropped a small container and lid on the counter, without saying anything.  I asked,  am I supposed to get the chili myself?  Without hearing his answer,  i walked to a table and put chili in the container.  Really put a bad taste in my mouth.   My parents were in the restaurant business for over 25 years,  I also worked in their restaurant having done everything from washing dishes to waiting tables to managing. I know that it's hard work and you can have a bad day.  However,  keep in mind it's a service business.  If you are going to have that type of attitude, just get another job.

8xyJ8iK3LXJ_PzI2Dfc3bA.text: I ordered take out. The service was good, but the food wasn't as good as I expected. It was ok, but I think it was lacking flavor and the pad Thai only has like 4 small shrimps. I guess you get what you pay for.

Fxl6ZsJ9KJFjVzk7thVrHw.text: I order so many times this place.. When I really craving for Thai food. Cause it's close to my house. Sometimes good meaning Not Bad..but sometimes really terrible too..I usually order and  take out.. And I usually tip them even it's take out, however there is one employee or maybe she is the owner???   Anyway she has bad attitude, if I don't give tips and ask for hot sauce to go I can feel that her attitude changes to very unpleasant mode.. You see this is Not Right.. That's why I don't go this place not much.. But I still order food from there time to time. Cause she is not there all the time.. My opinion is Not Bad!!

7wLJDpPat30opwHABdws7Q.text: Place is decently price and delicious. Came here for dinner and enjoyed my experience. Place was empty, but it was 9pm which is pretty late for dinner. I ordered the chicken skewers, tum yum soup, pad thai, and duck fried rice. The chicken skewers (#10 on the menu) were good, above average. I enjoyed eating it with the peanut sauce. The tum yum soup was also above average. I would of liked it with some rice, I liked it but wasn't blown away. I'm a big fan of pad thai but was unimpressed with the dish here. It wasn't bad but I had better at random Thai restaurants. The duck fried rice was delicious and my favorite dish of the night. Definitely a must try. Overall, I had a good dinner and was happy to try this place. I definitely recommend trying it once.

dV-WydByuJNV5kiwIdPxKg.text: Food is amazing!! This place is a hidden gem. We almost didn't go in but I'm glad we did. The chicken fried rice, chow menu, fried shrimp, crab Rangoon and fried broccoli was fabulous.

AHCYHfX9uQktJnEtTuFzUw.text: Usually this is my go to spot for Thai food, but the last time I ordered some pad see ew it looked all broken up into small pieces and very dry, like it came from the microwave it or recooked leftovers. Sorry to say will not be coming back.

gILl1e58kXJDo4qAd-Yk5g.text: I was visiting from Huntington Beach California and was looking for a Thai restaurant nearby my parents 2nd home. This came up in my search and I was pleasantly surprised! I eat a lot of Thai food in Orange County and this one was just as good if not better!

1Fgo2mhqgH5dJWu6AVyMsQ.text: Lots of good food. Big plates. I like the curry and my friend likes the noodles there.

19_Wb7ZaL26dXg5IKLuYuA.text: Everything is flame. Panang curry is flame. Pad Thai is flame. Crab fried rice is flame!  it's also cheaper than any other Thai restaurant

jy3vDi_v4Qwb12gXElZRNQ.text: Good food, reasonable price, friendly staffs and closed to my house. This place I think is way better than the Noodle House 1 in China Town as they are bigger and look way clean. We sometimes go to the one in China Town for lunch as its very convenient being closed to my workplace (the strip); but Ive always concerned about the cleanliness there. Happily they opened Noodle House 2 closed to my house for dinners. Definitely give it a try if you could.

a2vEA9TtbIhITiCKeZtKKg.text: My family and I have been going to this place on occasion now for several years. The food has been consistently good! The staff is always friendly and very service oriented. The menu is quite large with a good variety of items to choose from and reasonably priced. we've tried several dishes and everything is delicious!  Would definitely recommend to grab a quick bite to eat if you're in the mood for Thai food!

FeeWf9BjspXYkiKWzMeYFw.text: I can understand why this is highly rated. The food was very delicious. I ordered a vegetable egg roll (which I didn't think was exciting enough to photograph) and their roasted duck curry with steamed rice. Their portions were okay. I honestly expected more since it wasn't a lunch special order. It was a regular dinner size, made to share, order. And if I were sharing that with my family, boyfriend, or friends, that wouldn't satisfy anyone. Also, I ordered a spicy level of 7 (I'm a huge fan of spicy foods, and my go-to level is a 10, but I wanted to take it easy and just chill for the day), but that was not a 7 at all. It was like a 2. My boyfriend can't really handle spicy foods, and he said it wasn't bad. So that was a bit disappointing for me. The rice was good. It wasn't that typical hard rice in most Asian restaurants. Theirs was softer and a bit more moist. Although the food was delicious, I was disappointed by the portion and the spice level. Another reason why I decided to give them 3 stars is cause of the service. Asian restaurants typically have bad service, but it was annoying how they took a while to serve the food, even though it's been sitting out on the counter for a few minutes. Also, there was really only one server while we were there. And for a busy lunch, that's a no-no. The best thing about this place though is the cheap price. It's about $1-$2 cheaper than other Thai restaurants (eg. Archi's). The foods were delicious, no doubt. I'm just really picky when it comes to service and spice levels.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H_IzpB2xbZVQ-nSqWmVYjw.text: People are friendly soon as we walk in they greeted us, place is kinda clean I think they need to change the chairs it's kinda dirty already. Food was good we ordered beef combination and parang curry both were good definitely would be back to try the other menu they have to offer, price is pretty decent the also have lunch special ranging to 8.95  the place is easy to find near a barber ship. The compound itself has a lot of store.

eh9q0CWYqNLelrLpPlesKg.text: Foods are really tasty and cheap at the same time. We used to go to a fancy Thai restaurant just to eat pad see eu. But this one really has a better tasting dishes.

ymiX3cQnLMKKpF-pHBsKZQ.text: Really awesome place!  Great food. tried 5 dishes all B+ to A+ Quite affordable Extensive menu of many many dishes

oV8qlXhwj9iUrDVmN0hVOg.text: This location was up to par with their China town location. In my opinion the original location of a restaurant usually has better food but I wasn't disappointed.  We got rad na, seafood salad, and grilled beef salad.  Same affordable prices, same delicious take on Thai dishes.   Clean, friendly staff, fast turn out.

WKJzZEHrN1DokNGFcfapjA.text: I would give this place 0 stars if I could. I should have turned right around as soon as I saw how dirty and disgusting the fish tank was. Because I was with someone else I decided to give it a shot.  Mistake! I ordered the beef Pad Thai to be safe. As soon as I saw it I knew it was going to be bad news. It was very greasy with a very strong vinegar taste as well. I took one bite of the beef and wanted to vomit. I couldn't bear swallowing it. It tasted rotten. Instead of sending it back we paid for it and threw it away as soon as we walked outside. Don't waste your money. Definitely the worst Pad Thai ever!!!!

u6HuY9JlgcGi6fUAQ-KwJQ.text: This was my first time coming to this restaurant. It's located in the same plaza as Sweet Addictions, right across from iHOP. Came here because a friend wanted to try it out, overall experience wasn't that bad at all.   We decided to do it family style and get three dishes that we would all share. First up was the Papaya Salad, I've never had it before this, but it was good. Nothing too notable, papaya, carrots, peppers, tomato, and cabbage with a sauce that I can't really describe the taste (gotta try it again). I think we ordered a 6 as far as the spicy level goes, it wasn't overly spicy but you can definitely tell it was spicy. I think I was expecting something different as far as how spicy this was going to be, so it caught me a little off guard.   We got a Green Curry Fried Rice with chicken, also level 6 spicy. This was pretty good, none of us have had it before so we weren't sure what to expect, but it's literally the green curry flavoring cooked into their fried rice. It wasn't overly powering, but you can definitely taste the green curry along with our choice level of spiciness. It contained the chicken, green bean, bean sprout, and carrots, don't recall if there was anything else in it. It wasn't dry at all, which was good, they didn't over cook it!   And lastly we got the Choo Chee Salmon, which none of us have had but heard good things about. So this was the best thing out of all the dishes we ordered. I really enjoyed the sauce, which was semi sweet. I'll need to try it a few more times before I can figure out what was in it, but it was good and I will definitely be ordering this again when I go back! The salmon was moist and cooked very well. My friends and I all enjoyed it and actually wanted more, though we were pretty stuffed by the end.  The cost overall between three people was $10 each including tip, so it wasn't bad at all. We were all satisfied at the end.

wrSYHemgcwOkWlFaarsI7Q.text: I'm becoming a Panang addict. I have to try it wherever I go. Tonight was no exception. After reading Anthony M's ROTD, I figured this would be a good place to take my Dad for a little birthday dinner with my brother.  Panang Avocado with Salmon. Doesn't that just sound awesome? Well it wasn't mind-blowing, but it was pretty good. Honestly, I still prefer Archi's Panang overall, but I love the fact that it comes with ample large chunks of salmon and avocado. It's kind of a perfect little marriage. You take some salmon and avocado in with your rice on each spoonful. The combination works swimmingly.  As it turns out, my Dad no longer eats spicy food. Fortunately, there are plenty of options for him. He ended up going with the Seafood Wonton soup. It looked delicious and had plenty of seafood. I like the uber-wide bowl they use to serve the soup. My brother went with the Yellow Curry with Tofu. I didn't ask him how it was, but he seemed to enjoy it.  As a side note, it was strange that the place was basically empty when we got there, but within minutes, the place was full. It's like after we sat down, a constant stream of customers just kept walking in until all the tables filled up. Also, I found the TV programming to be interesting. I used to love home improvement shows and seeing an Asian version was definitely entertaining.

x8uLajdwJSRHD6Ax6v_5zQ.text: Food was great! Prices were great! Customer service? HORRIBLE! Waitress had a horrible attitude when asking for an extra sticky rice for our daughters. She never even brought it out. Never came to refill our drinks. Just bad service.

iMOrI1fQh4rtsIqomEX0Nw.text: Great staff, great prices with huge portions! My boyfriend got the pork larb and it was full of flavor. I can taste the spices and the lettuce was crunchy and fresh. I got the duck noodle soup. I can't really find this anywhere unless I go to LA, so I had to get it here. It was so delicious and full of duck flavor. Duck broth is naturally on the salty side, so don't be surprised if you think it is salty. It taste great! :) we ordered the Thai tea to wash down the spiciness. The Thai tea is just as good as archies, maybe better. For dessert we got fried Ice cream. Its a giant ball of goodness. The guy that works there, Victor, is really sweet and told us to come back for lunch because the deals are better! I am definitely coming back for lunch to see what else they have to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ice cream
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck noodle soup

BxNdPjRxfurD7KyLynLIZQ.text: Love love love love love!!! I'm a creature of habit so I always get the pan nang curry with chicken and sticky rice. And I like it hot! Owner is super nice too

QooN7p9HACjuVZJZ_gZQzA.text: Missing my Thai noodle joint in LA. If you're ever around the area- hit up Pa Ord Noodle in E. Hollywood... The BEST soups.... So good, after I ate the meat and noodles; I wanted to drink the bowl of soup! That broth is good.....  With that high expectation.... Thai Style Noodle House didn't meet it. Don't get me wrong TSNH is good! But it's not Pa Ord.  TSNH's portion is very generous (love it!),  the decor is clean, service is friendly and they also deliver within a 3 mile radius.  Overall 3.5 stars, good food, good service, and good prices- I'll go for another round.

VDzEKDNyl2iEZsev59wWAA.text: I love this place . There food is very good . They have a number customer service . It's always good I usually try to go to this place once a week . They also have really good Thai tea and there orange chicken is so light  that you taste the chicken instead of the bread

tcwTMCKFJd0Ruk6qn2IE6w.text: Food is just ok but the services is very very bad. 2 waitress just keep talking to each other we ask for one more white rice it's never come. I will never come back to this place.

b4RdMStjY7olkhzo9QkhBQ.text: Great food! I'm allergic to shell fish and some Asian restaurants use a fish sauce that contain shell fish or shrimp so I have to be super careful where I eat. I went in and asked about their fish sauce and they brought out a bottle and let me read the ingredients. The only "fish" was anchovy. That was super great that they did that.  I only gave 4 stars because my yellow curry chicken and chicken pad Thai was skimpy on the chicken.  Over all, two thumbs up!

oubW9E4GUSJDNmIhZSkZfw.text: I love this restaurant, it's always great.  You can always dine in or take out. I believe they offer delivery but I have to double check. Duck soup it's one of my favorite, also they have a variety of noddles. Everything I have tried so far has been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles, we got the mixed( beef, chicken, shrimp and veggies) it was the first time trying it and we loved it.
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil crispy pork was delicious. You can pick from the scale 1-10 how spicy you want it. I love TSNH2!

3NHOwwvR7ihocvO_PqEOGQ.text: Recently I ordered take out here and I was greeted immediately when I walked in. The wait time for my food was less then 15 minutes and I was out that door. I ordered the Pad See Eww- it was delicious, Fried Pork with Chinese broccoli- never disappoints me, squid salad and somtum was not what I expected. I always ask for the squid salad to be less sweet and more on the sour side but they can't seem to make it sour enough.   As for the Somtum I requested it to be made Lao style with 1 Thai pepper which would be enough spice for me and asked for it to be extra sour. Well it wasn't sour, and I think they skipped on the pepper or didn't use real Thai chili pepper/prik ki nou. It really makes a difference on the type of chili you use.   Overall, the food is still great and the prices are the best in town!!

PwX_Kx7bV5rx8xuRSudjQQ.text: I tried this spot for the first time, desperate for some good Thai without having to drive all the way downtown. I was greeted right away by a friendly fella... I placed my order to go after looking at the menu for a minute. I got the potstickers without the mayo (I despise mayo) and the beef Pad See-eu spicy level 7, I love spicy. When I got home, I dug into the potstickers... They were so bomb. I'm definitely getting them every time. Next the Pad See-eu. It was okay, but I tasted absolutely no spice. Really I tasted no seasoning at all, it was bland but not terrible. I probably wouldn't order that again but I am looking forward to trying other items on the menu. Overall it was a good experience, everyone was kind, food was ready quick and the potstickers were a win.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy basil fried rice with beef... Spicy level 8... So good

Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

GppHPZHMz7CvG8-tVIXNTw.text: I think Thai Style Noodle House might be my newest favorite Thai place! I got to try the original location first and liked it a lot and since this one is a lot closer to home it's definitely a winner. Although my review is a bit biased since I've only had the beef noodle soup as an entree, it was very tasty and definitely a good lunch size portion for $6.50. My friends enjoyed their curry that they had and pad thai as well. I remember trying the chicken satay and crab rangoons which were decent as well. Prices are reasonable and you can't really go wrong with this place. Their thai iced tea and coffee are a bit on the sweet side, like diabetic sweet so just a fair warning.  $15 dollar minimum to use your credit card.  I will be back!

s7cZa6FYf9w5FDKhBrPXFA.text: I really liked the Thai Red Curry (Seafood) I ordered from this place. The price was good, too, something like $8.50. It was just perfect.  Howeverrrr.....  It was just me & hubby at the resto when we walked in. Our server had a lot of time to do things between taking our order & serving our food.  He chose to spend his spare time cleaning the fish tank. Using his hands. I should have taken a photo of the fish tank, its water brown & murky. I'm pretty sure that water had fish cr** in it, plus other contaminants & I dunno, possibly diseases. I didn't see our server wash his hands after cleaning the tank. He just wiped them with napkins. Sorry, I just thought that was really unsanitary :/

bNgrS4dtPZAbnD0rMXVO7A.text: This place is not bad, but not anything super delicious either. I come here, because the food is fairly decent, and it's close to home.

X1hm2tpsGiMeKZqZZwz3fw.text: This place is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. My favorite is shrimp pad Thai with a 5 for the spicy level. The price is pretty good for the quality of the pad Thai! I have tried the green curry and the red curry. I love them both! Definitely not a 5 star restaurant but I would give it 4 stars! !

-uidGb4olxJp_W_0slFcDQ.text: I can't believe I haven't left a review for TSNH2! I've been to many of the Thai places around this area and always end up back here. It's inexpensive, open late, less than a 5 minute drive away from my house, and they've got some key menu items that keep me coming back. Like several other Asian joints, the service is probably not what you'd expect. Once in a while, they'll forget to give you a napkin or have to go back to grab your utensils and there might even be some miscommunication, but the food is well worth it. Not a huge fan of their pad thai, but I love their duck fried rice and pretty much any of the curries. The portions are generous and the food doesn't take very long either.   Cheap Thai cuisine that tastes good within 5 minutes of my home... Uhm. What else is there to say?

YayTXrtEA1cO0qu0YCUcRg.text: Not great.  Small portions of orange chicken (mostly batter) and panang curry(though the curry WAS BY FAR the best dish we got). Also tried the pad see eiw which we should have left....

PpeinExVHtZ3TTaAKrDM7A.text: Great Thai place that my co-workers found.  Love the place, although it's not really as hot as you think a 10 star would be.  I'd say that it's been toned a little for the customer base.  Food is fantastic.   Thai iced tea is awesome too if you need a little something to take the edge off.  Price is very reasonable for Thai food and I'd definitely recommend the pumpkin yellow curry!

SBmVJNLIfPMRGxvVn1WRRQ.text: Been going here with my parents for years! We absolutely love Thai Noodle House, especially this location. Food is always amazing, cheap, and the service has never disappointed us.   I would highly recommend coming here if you've never been and are looking for an authentic and tasty Thai restaurant in the area.

b2cWOv-QdUk4s_jLsWtYgQ.text: I came here first time and I think last time for me.! Some food it's ok but yellow curry no tick and no test  Service to slow . Never go back again .

cpUdiFGW6WwBpK3dhqX0NA.text: I placed my order to go from this place in hopes I'd finally find my go to Thai restaurant. But sadly this will not be our go to.   I asked for certain levels of spice in my food, and when I say spice I mean HOT, I like it spicy. Only one item had a note of spice on it out of 5 items. And for the price, there wasn't very much food. The food was bland aside from the pad Thai. It was heavy on the peanut taste and that is allllll you could taste.

SY2L6GzxNDsjnLpQ_fxzhA.text: Delicious and at a fair price.  The staff is so friendly. This is a mom and pop place but they are so nice and attentive. The food is great and available at a variety of spiciness levels for everyone's taste. I had the chicken pad ke su (drunken noodles). It was delicious and flavorful. The best time is to come is is for lunch their specials are great and cheap. You get soup and a side of wonton or egg roll with your entree. The interior is very small about 8 tables and it isn't very fancy inside but the food makes up for it. It is also very clean and I noticed an A rating by the health department posted.

fofOHLwqvO0SJi3dN_K62A.text: Order delivery instead of eating in today !  The flavor and everything just as good even not eating in !  Fried tofu is still super scrunchy my fav for appetizer  Beef jerky and pork jerky is way better than other places  I love the house noodles soup especially when I'm not feeling well to eat anything else , this soup a combo of everything group chicken , lean pork and  fish ball  ...just perfect  The duck soup so flavorful with egg noodles-just perfect as well   They always super fast with their services eating in or order out , you never have to wait for the foods to come like forever !  And best of all are their price is super cheap compare to any other Thai's restaurant in town ! they have 3 location but I usually go to this one and sometimes the one in China Town on Spring Mountain

0EJKtSJK7zLk59GJr9aiJQ.text: I've been here since they opened. Sometimes  noodles little salty but most time so taste. Service was fast and good.

Fc97wS8ZC1YHPjUxCVFyLA.text: 3 stars for decent food at a reasonable price. Quality used to be a lot better when I first started coming here but it's gradually going down. I'm still hopeful that one day there will be some kind of improvement. I stopped coming here because of that but last night I gave it another chance. It's better than the last time I was here so I'm pretty sure I'll be back someday.  My faves are the spicy eggplant, crab fried rice and pad see ew. The eggplant was a bit undercooked. I hope they were not rushing to get the food out just because they have a lot of phone orders.  Service was a bit slow as well although they were nice enough to checked back with us every so often.   The husband was a bit disappointed with the Thai iced tea which was not refillable as most of Thai restaurants in town offers unlimited refills.   Overall, if you are looking for reasonable decent Thai food then this is the place for you.

Q_sZZretEaCManNkMtuaSA.text: Update: Beware of the new cook... The food was soooo bland. There's no flavor in the food at all. We ended up returning the food after a couple bites cuz it was so bad. Now I'm scared of going there, what if it's the new cooks shift today?

1q1OZEdYB8zGH5R8-lZA1A.text: A HIDDEN GEM I absolutely love Thai food! The spices, flavors, $ creativity of the dishes make the food so tasty.   Recommendations were amazing. I even customized a few dishes that are indicative of Thai Food with their assistance. Tom Yum soup with Clear Noodles and a Shrimp Red Panang Curry. Topping it off with the classic sticky (deliciously f$@kin amazing) rice with Mango.   Service is on point. Food comes out fast and flavors are different (in a great way) than I'm used to with Thai Food. The weather is nice & chilly and I wanted something to warm me up. I asked for it. I got it. Now I'm heading out, barely spent anything, and have sweat dripping down my forehead. I am someone who loves spice but you don't have to get anything here spicy. They make sure to ask you up front.   Thank you Thai House Family. Can't wait to come back!

3YEahWyvJvP1-t9aBTYC-g.text: I really like Thai Noodle House restaurants. They have multiple locations. Prices are really cheap!  Ive been to a few thai restaurants and this is the only place I really like the pad thai.   Papaya salad is good but I wish it came with more portions.  Spicy Basil fried rice is also delicious!   When ordering for pick up make sure you have the right location!

Can't even put an order properly .  Damn this place .  Never will I go back here , again.  I order the same things all the time and this time they get it wrong and get pissed at me?  BEWARE !!!

LRAqbMG9M6VI2wOHnEgp8g.text: Something about Thai food will always bring me to check out other Thai restaurants.. it's like a game of who makes the best yellow curry and pad thai..  This place falls in the normal category, which means it's good and I will be visiting again for sure but I'm looking for a restaurant who cam beat one I found in Hawaii that I have crowned the pad Thai champion.   The service here was pretty on point too.. always coming to fill waters and whatever else drinks I ordered. So don't shy away from this establishment of you're looking to get a fix.. this place is more than enough for that.  Not to mention the prices were great!

AuAUAY4c_CCAufXNwuQbzQ.text: Welp, we found our new regular Thai spot in LV. This place isn't far from our house, has super reasonable prices, generous portions, and the quality and variety of food is really outstanding.   It's clear that by the number of Doordash, Uber Eats, and other food delivery services that dropped by for pickup orders while we were eating in that their to-go services are their main source of income.   The atmosphere inside is very unassuming, but the expansive menu will change that impression. My husband and I ordered pad-kee-mow, tofu pad thai, and crab fried rice. I tried each dish in our collection of fried carbs, and devoured way more than I usually do; (which is saying a lot since I was in my third trimester of pregnancy.) Needless to say, it was all superb. We'll be ordering from here again - maybe for to-go!

RDTNSSeFfwhaOBP7ZKKVrA.text: I'm not going to lie, Lotus of Siam has pretty much ruined me for Thai food. I have a hard time eating it elsewhere.   I have to say that this place is pretty solid. We got take out. Spicy Thai noodles (5 stars), beef jerky (2.5 stars), panang curry (4.5 stars), and papaya salad (4 stars).   I'm glad I found this place as it is sort of on the way home from my daughter's school.   A lot of people mentioned "huge" or "generous" portions in their reviews. I definitely didn't have that experience....portions were pretty normal and totally fine. I was just expecting a tad more, based in reviews. Maybe they were referring to dining inside. It was enough food, I only mention it in case anyone is expecting a lot for takeout.   Overall, very tasty and would like to come try more next time!

UlfH--OPHrKckD7DqBWSVQ.text: I  got pad Thai which was really good. I didn't think it was spicy. The spice level is from 1 to 10 I got a level 9. I also got one of the  curries which wasn't good.  I  think I wasted my money on that plus I think it was old.  The Thai tea was good a little bit too sweet.  The service was another story.  As the guy was taking our second order he a mint in his mouth as he was talking it fell out of his mouth and he looks real quick and puts it back.  Who does that? He didn't even say sorry. And yes it did touch the table.  I don't think I will be going back to this location.

J7fw64KXVVk8sncB2Bm5Jg.text: Had the pad sew and fried ice cream and it was delicious. I will definitely come back for that, only complaint I had is that the service was painfully slow. Our server was busy on her phone the whole time and didn't even come check on us. Second she gave me the wrong plate that I never ordered. We had to keep yelling for her trying to get her attention while she was in the front on her phone.

ju-d0cbSprtoBwfOXEGv2w.text: Bomb and cheap Thai food in Vegas, hands down! Their potstickers are very good, as well as the Panang curry chicken, and the garlic pepper chicken. Every time I go I want to feast!

YlKIg_-KRNQW5CZt_IC9PA.text: Fast and friendly service.    Although not on the menu we requested tofu with our meals and they were happy to add it.   We ordered the vegaterian egg rolls Delish  I ate soup and my husband beans,  friend tofu and rice.  Both were good.   Price point was awesome Our meals came to 20$ for two entrees and a appetizer   We would go back again

5CGXhPd792zUDjK81E6d2Q.text: Ordered the Kung pow beef, what I got was rice 80% 17% vegetables and 3% beef with some sauce that was nothing like Kung pow sauce and it was so thin it ran under the rice so there was none for the beef. What a waist of money, not ever going back.......

frubVt1GjIGQj6y6wdfKfQ.text: First things first. If you are looking for lunch specials or any type of specials...you're not gonna find any here. Same menu as lunch versus dinner.   Prices weren't too bad. $6.95 for a chicken pad thai plate. Couple bucks more if you want shrimp instead of chicken.  My boyfriend and I both got pad thai. Sorry...I'm original like that. I just can't go to a thai restaurant and NOT get pad thai. I would LOVE to try something different...but I could just never seem to do it.  I like spicy foods. Side note: not sure if everyone is aware of this, but on a scale of 1-10, 1 being the LEAST spicy and 10 being the MOST. Not sure if its different in other thai restaurants but I personally never knew that. Here I've been getting spicy level 4 thinking #1 was considered the MOST spicy. -__- oh geez. Sooooo....I ended up getting a level 8 spiciness.   Getting back to the food, I really loved this place. My pad thai came out pippin' hot and the spiciness was on point. Definitely the kind of spice I was expecting. It has a kick to it without having to sip on water every 30 seconds.   This is definitely a place I'll come back to if I'm ever in this part of town.

Jvg-tmBdv8tEG5ToQhce8w.text: We eat here randomly but enough times to have a good enough opinion to say they have some great dishes. I have tried a few and so far so good. The rice plates are more like a dinner combo for one person maybe 2. The prices are awesome! Fried rice was good, beef pad sew (spelled wrong) is really good, garlic chicken was good ( rice plate ) fast service, friendly staff

x_JL0H-GTNUooAM1dsM36w.text: Not bad for the price. Ordered pad se ue, pad Thai and yellow chicken curry. The curry wasn't thick at all but the taste was good. And the other two were good but I've had better. If u want lower priced Thai food this is a good place.

gH0TyKfbwLspDicccBMaqw.text: Food portions were way off, at least for the entrees that include rice. I ordered an entree for about $7.50 and it was 15% entree and 85% rice. They need to be a little more generous so I feel like I'm getting what I pay for. Will go elsewhere next time

v6dFAapxLuZoCuwGugmZWA.text: I go to this restaurant about 2 times a month. I love everything here! I have tried almost 20 different items on their menu and every single one has been fantastic.   Hands down, the best thing here is the potstickers! I wish they had an all you can eat potsticker special because quite frankly 6 isn't enough. :)  This place has very good food at a cheap price. I have never eaten at the restaurant as I always call in and order.   I suggest this place to anyone in the mood for Thai food!

egQtO7ETmtfDF3kgnVzapg.text: Prices are great. Portions are good. Nearby. We're regulars!   My husband's on a Thai kick. Have no idea why, but he wants to try every Thai place in town. We were frequent visitors of Basil and Lime then Surang's but I believe that my husband and I have found our "spot". The staff is really friendly and the food is good.   If you're used to the traditional flavors of Thai food, then there's a possibility that you may not like this place. AND the reason why I say that is because of the pad thai & the ladnar (Sp?). These are two dishes that I ordinarily do NOT like at other places, there's usually a funky taste to them and I have no idea how to describe them, they taste almost spoiled to me... I personally am not able to enjoy them because of that. But TSNH's version has me going in for more every time!   We're here a minimum of 2 times a week. Yep-- return visits.

tQ8fivjvqXXs77oX_I6LBw.text: I had a great lunch from this restaurant. I just picked up a couple small items on my way home and everything was correct when I got back to my house!  (With take-out that is always my first concern...making sure everything made it into the bag) I can't really comment on the service or the decor...but from what I saw it looked nice!  I will definitely go back and check the place out in further detail.   Enjoy

9LONxyW2eC9r_UWYsY3G0Q.text: 3 stars for the food minus -1 for the service equals 2.  Called for explanation on the menu but the guy on the other end was to busy to explain. Asked what goes in the different curries but instead he rattles off the colors. I could sense the impatience in he voice. Already ordered fried rice and i was very tempted to cancel that but since it was my sons I kept it.  When I went there the place was empty except for 1 table so why couldn't he explain some of the menu to me? He said MAYBE he couldn't hear me. I told him the simple solution to that was to turn down the music, dah!!!! There are other Thai restaurants in the area. Don't need to put up with that kind of service especially since I'm giving them my business.

fZ7zcm0XPTWKMT1TlxhUMw.text: I agree with one reviewer here, there has been a bunch of Thai restaurants popping up all over Ft. Apache lately and I've tried most of them and so far my favorite is still Archie's, UNTIL I found this place!  I called and ordered take out and the food is ready in 15 minutes. Everything was delicious and just the right amount of spice. I usually order a 2 spice level and most of the time it will be way too hot but not this place, they got it just right.  I ordered: SIlver Noodle Salad, Thai Fried Rice with Chicken, Thai Spice Noodle with Beef, and Yellow Curry and my total was $29! It's the cheapest Thai restaurant around here and the food is delicious and very generous portions, what more can you ask for?
