knJBE57xM2-s4AVoLgH29Q.text: I called for a pick up order only to drive there and find out that that their credit card machine is broken and that it's cash only. I didn't have any cash so I just left with no food, wasted gas and the worst part of it was that they didn't even apologize about the fact that they didn't tell me on the phone that it was broken before I drove there. Also I asked them why didn't tell me on the phone that the machine is broken and they basically just looked me at and said nothing with and "oh well " face. If I just wasn't so hungry I wouldn't have came back, so I brought cash with me and they tried to hand me the old curry I ordered had to ask them to make it fresh for me and looked mad about it. Ridiculous!!

FHgj-neXUxlxtTildBmCiw.text: The curry with chicken and pumpkin was outstanding! Food was tasty and delicious. The service was five star!

dWotm2eHoIYAwjtn36DL5g.text: I like reviewing places for the purpose that they serve, so they don't necessarily need orgasmic, revolutionary food just to garner a full 5 stars.  This place is good and cheap- great for what it is.  Interior is what it is too, nothing super splendid but not shabby either.  They have the Thai channel on as you wait for your food, which can be entertaining at times to see the monkey dancing and other oddities.  Service is fine- quick and attentive.  But their food..  very, very nice.  There was only one other place in Vegas that had bigger portions of pad thai, but that place closed down.  Whomp whomp.  I've tried plenty of their dishes and it's only when I tasted their praram dish that I had to write a review.  It's a stir fry of vegetables and any choice of meat, topped with peanut sauce.  To my, peanut sauce is like an aphrodisiac, and this dish had PLENTY.  So.  Good.  I went here with a friend and I've been returning with more friends ever since.  I'm always hungry late night so an hour or two before they close, if I'm feeling hungry, I'll stop by the place and get something quick.  All other Thai places nearby are way too expensive for what they're putting out- if you're craving it and are in the area, you gotta stop by.

tHIfeqkAIDHw42QAHYXBAQ.text: So my review could be a little skewed because I'm pregnant and starving BUT here's what happened: driving home from work, it suddenly dawns on me that I NEED something spicy. I Yelp places nearby and the word 'Thai' won me over. I call to order Drunken Noodles to go and pleasantly surprised it's ready just as I walk in! I could not have handed her my card any faster. Spork in the bag? Check. I speed walked to my car and OMG. It smells so good. I didn't wanna eat it all in the car but... I just couldn't stop. I mean, I'm eating for two so whatevs I own't judge me. Oh and on the way out, I was casually eyeing people's food and I saw some kind of soup that looked mouthwatering so you betta believe I'll be back. Moral of the story: So good I'm still sitting in my car to write about it.

CiNy98tiiNhoLoUTk2O8qQ.text: I have no clue why there are so many Thai restaurants on such a short stretch of Fort Apache, though I'm not complaining.  I've only been here once, but I would come back again. The service was really quick and friendly. I ordered the beef pad thai from the regular menu since it isn't on the lunch menu. It was less than $7 for the pad thai and the serving size was generous. If you prefer more main dish at the expense of not getting the usual side items that come with a lunch menu order, then come here.  One negative is that they only take debit/credit on orders over $10. As a person that rarely carries cash and likes to track all my spending via my credit card, I definitely dislike that company policy.

jlP_8WAa5OkE1NuVPCmkwA.text: The is food great!  All dishes have a good ratio of meat & vegetables.  If you're new to this restaurant, they do give great suggestions.  For the vegetarians out there, they have a vegetarian menu that they don't normally present unless you request it.  I absolutely love the vegetarian items.  Must haves are tofu larb and fresh ginger with steamed tofu.  Be sure to finish off with mango sticky rice.

YPMyw-SVoy5lefzcplDXpQ.text: Five stars because I didn't even leave a noodle on my plate.  It was that good.  Gonna keep this review short and simple.  Excellent Thai food for cheaper than most other places in town.  For my first time, I tried the Pad Thai - my food mood was yelling at me to eat Pad Thai.  It was wonderful and the perfect combination of ingredients and spice.  I agree with some other reviewers that I wish there were a Thai Style Noodle House in Henderson!  Definitely recommend this place!

zpea_CoZrd_Nix8CrJtzGQ.text: This is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  Try these: Lad Nah noodles Papaya salad Grilled pork Pad Se-Eu Hoi Toad

504ICbtzAk6qfc0GpusW7g.text: When I came to this restaurant for the very first time, the food was great. So, I had a great impression of this restaurant, However, the service is really bad and unfriendly. The servers were treating the customers very differently. The server was very generous and greeted the customers. Yet, whenever we came, she never treated us the same. It felt like she was ignorant. The server was refilling water in every customer's cup. However, she never came to our table, which was a great disappointment. I felt the big difference between the other customers and us. It felt like we were discriminated. It was an unwelcome dinner. Never coming here again.

3eleJdIco_JWCv2Bx0I64w.text: Super yummy!  Best soups ever.. Fast take out, great to dine in as well.  I found my new soup house.

oWdik1cPQXVR257cRw2rtA.text: Finally went to this place since it's closer to my house then the Thai Style Noodle house #1 on Spring Mtn and Wynn. This place is still as good as the first place. I ordered the same things such as the House Tom Yum Noodle which was delicious, Papaya Salad spicy 8 hit the spot, Pad Thai, Fried chicken, and the fried rice and chinese sausage and pork. All item were authentic.   Service was great. I believe the waitress came from #1. The restaurant is very cute and comfortable. The food came out really fast too.  I would definitely recommend this place over any Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Thai Style Noodle House #1 and #2 are my first choices! If you want the old school feel i would go to #1 and more modern would be #2... both same in taste..

tuXnxf0ZnYc5gPEu-GvnBg.text: Actually Thai Style Noodle House #2, this is a sister/twin of Thai Style Noodle House on Wynn Road. I have written a review for Thai Style #1previously.   The decor for #2 is much nicer than #1. It still has the feel of a local eatery and it's in a newly build strip mall. There is an ornate brass ceiling with chandeliers but the walls are plain orange with a few Pier 1 type art pieces hanging. Nothing too fancy or garish. Nice. The place had a steady stream of customers...not too crowded and not too awkwardly lonely either. A perfect lunch spot.   The service here was also just as good as #1. One of the waitresses at #2 was the same waitress I had at #1.   I was slightly miffed that they did not have vegetarian/vegan lunch specials (as I was told that by the waitress) and had to order off the menu. I ordered the Papaya Salad and the Spicy Flat Noodles (Pad Kee Mao on Thai menus usually). I liked that they had the option to get steamed tofu instead of friend. I opted for the steamed and have to say although let's face it, the fried is much better, this was rather good. I got my food within 10 minutes. The papaya salad was consistent with my experience at #1 and the Flat Noodles were also tasty. I didn't like the addition of white pepper on top of the noodles as a finishing touch. I might tell them to omit that the next time I go there. The flat noodles was sauteed with basil, garlic, steamed tofu, carrots, onions and cabbage. Not out of this world but tasty and satisfied me for lunch.  Papaya Salad + Spicy Flat Noodles + Diet Coke = $15. The meal will last me at least one more day. Not too shabby but would have appreciated a veggie lunch special.   I'm glad these guys opened up something on this side of town. It's close to work and I can frequent when I have a Thai craving.   PS. I tried to take pictures and make this the first review that I started picture adding but I don't know how to turn off the flash on my camera...currently all my pics are bright lights. Once I get more camera savvy I will be going crazy posting pictures.

xI9RT4Uc5CWmoJH-CvWROA.text: I gave it a 2 star  because of the ff:  1. Server - friendly  2. Ambiance - okay 3. Wait - we waited for 30 minutes for our food  4. Food - 2 star ( I ordered pork bbq with papaya salad) pork bbq is good, but papaya is really spicy for 7. My husband ordered combination soup which is alright.  5. Price - okay

jxUnnDh2drnF8bJznql2Fw.text: Awesome food. My toddlers loved the fried chicken (thin strips) and fried rice. I had the spicy Thai noodle with 5 out of 10 spicy and really enjoyed it. We also ordered WooChee salmon and the 3 spice sauce was crazy yummy.  It is a small casual, mompop kind of place. Service was friendly.  We will be coming back regularly.

0iTSGMM3-3Oy_EiSZudOtg.text: I have eaten here several times, and I tend to always get their Cashew Chicken.  My boyfriend tries different things and everything is always delicious.  The prices are extremely affordable, and the food is always so fresh.  The staff are very friendly, and we love coming to this restaurant or ordering pickup.  You can get 2 entrees plus an appetizer for about $20.  Can't beat that.  We've tried the other Thai places along Ft. Apache, and this one is our favorite!

1tIDI0dEuIF4hafxKSOSew.text: Tasty fish cakes, yummy curry, very reasonable pricing. The rad nar is lacking in the flavor department -needs garlic- and they tend to skimp on the coconut milk in the curry. It's a mystery as to why the noodle soups get cold so quick when eating there. Possibly the wide shallow dishes that are used for soup dishes. Papaya salad compliments any dish, especially meat dishes. Generous portions leave diners satisfied and for an additional charge; brown rice instead of white rice makes a great healthy choice. This is a delicious destination for foodies on a budget.

N5illXjMoFguajuqOoDfiw.text: Pin Kaow is my all time favorite Thai restaurant and I have always been a bit sketcy about trying different thai places due to recurring disappointment. I noticed this place that is right up the street from my house and was really curious, I read all the reviews and most of them were really good so I decided to try this place for a work week lunch ( not to ruin my date night dinner, if I was disappointed). Well to my surprise, this place was really good.  I ordered the Shrimp fried rice #10 (as I always do) I told my coworker that it was almost perfect, my only hold back was that the shrimp were a little on the medium/small side and were a little dried out but the flavors were DELICIOUS and they actually made it a #10 as most places don't think that I can handle it and usually make it around a #6 or #7!!! Keep in mind that the shrimp might have been like that because I did get it to go and they most likely just kept cooking in the to go container.  I went home and told my husband about it and we made plans to go that Friday and he would test it out to see if he would like it. Skeptical as I was, he was so surprised at how much he LOVED IT!!!!  He oredered the Duck Fried rice #10, we split the Shrimp Pad Se Eww #10 and I again got Shrimp fried rice number #10. This time the shrimp were perfect, I think it makes a difference when you take it to go. The pad se eww was delicious as was the duck fried rice. The next best thing was the Price All 2 dishes came to just over $27.00. I couldn't even believe it. When we order those same 3 dishes at Pin Kaow it comes over $37.00. The duck fried rice is $5.00 more at Pin Kaow.  That is what I really like about the place, no matter how popular they get they don't raise their prices and that will keep us coming back over and over again.   I would recommend this place over and over again and you better believe that we will be there yet again this Friday night.

8h-1t-McIRI_ml6pVwHt-A.text: I'll be returning. Good noodle dishes, both of us had a great time here. Good service. Good taste. Along with modest prices.

-fYxKzrzvWnikjerSKREAQ.text: Pork jerky...check... Reasonable price...check... Overall a decent meal for a decent price...I've had better..but will definitely come back for the pork jerky...service is good too, so definitely worth trying.

ZZ4mcas7S9BtcY5k5AfuBA.text: My Wife and I found this place after moving to Las Vegas a year ago from Orange County, California. We were soooo excited and happy that we found a Great Thai Food place with Great tasting and with consistency since we are absolute die hard fan of Thai and Chinese food. But on the third visit we placed order by phone for pick up. Upon arriving home and looking at dish we ordered (Mongolian Beef was one), food did not look anything close or taste anything close to Mongolian Beef which we had for soo many times. White color cooked meat in a runny watery beige liquid. Being one of die-hard fan of this dish and having it for past 25+ years I never seen a Mongolian Beef looking like this. Total disappointment.  Today 8/28 my wife and I figured to give them one more chance. What a Mistake that was. the best part of the lunch was cold can of coke. Pineapple Curry which I ordered was sooo watery. My wife's food had totally different color (Same Dishes we both orders the first 2 visit) and tasted completely different. When asked why the food look  and taste so much different they could not give us an straight answer. Appears they use the earlier customers left over and mix few stuff to serve the new customers order. That seems the only explanation that we can come up with if the owner claims everything in the restaurant is the same as before.  Bottom line going to this place is like rolling the dice. if you are lucky you end up with good food otherwise you are in for an experience which turns you off from any Thai food.

AuGlLaCJQuCJPK9BT1DF3g.text: Every now and then I like to treat myself to a cheat meal and i just remembered how i fell so much in love with the Thai Basil with Chicken just prior to my change in lifestyle.  A friend wanted Thai food, so I suggested this spot since it was closer to both of us as oppose to the other location.  Judging by this dish alone i would have never guess that the two Thai Style Noodle House are sister properties.  It was just so terrible and tasteless compare to the other one.  Not enjoyable at all.  So much that I would not think about coming back and play it safe by sticking to the original one on Wynn.  Oh, but hey, nice ceiling!

8ScRymJoOHry4IJvOE1zjQ.text: Not good.  We ordered the chicken wings, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice last night.  The woman on the phone was very nice, and informed us the delivery would take about 45 minutes, since they were busy.  We were fine with this, unfortunately I can't say the same about the food.  The Pad thai showed up in a large clump of mushy noodles.  The flavors were all there, but the texture ruined the dish.    The Fried Chicken wings had feathers on them.  Yes, feathers.  This should never happen, but clearly someone in the kitchen was rushing.  Either way, disgusting.  The Pineapple fried rice lacked the flavor many others have had, but it wasn't gross, just not very good.  It was on the light side which was nice, but still is not worth ordering.   I'm not remotely interested in trying this place again, there are way too many Thai restaurants to settle for poor quality food.

8laIQmhvQYQDLbrt-DPNcg.text: Foods are good. But the male server( with glasses)  has terrible service. We've been there three times, the same server same terrible service. Won't really say a word to us. Only word he said was " you done?" Female server was totally different. Would come to us ask if everything ok. Has very friendly smile. Never go there eat again if the male server still works there.

-sthcE8BSXCajgWnSeEDcQ.text: Very average thai restaurant. Average quality food and poor service. Lotus of Siam is much, much better.

nAorPYMwLjbQh5WmURnGww.text: Spicy basil fried rice, oh how I love thee. Yellow curry, spicy papaya salad and yummy spring rolls, are all must have's. And they have a separate vegan menu. Score.

EOfhrtz2_gk4UJpH0MGr1A.text: This place is the best. Their Tia tea is good and so is there food only problem is that they don't have " fresh Spring rolls".

kjT_66e0bjlMOF53nCJBBg.text: Favorite Thai restaurant by far.  Same great prices as the Wynn location in Chinatown, but much nicer dining area inside.  Staff is always friendly.  Food is always amazing and prices are phenominal...reminiscent of great Thai places I used to eat at in Seattle.

b_YIXW7K3nfzAwA5akFYpA.text: Everything was good.  It's a cute little place and the service was nicer than usual from Asian joints.    They had a very creative seasonal item on the special board - pumpkin curry! We gave it a try and it was excellent, the best thing we had.  We also had the spicy eggplant with ground beef, the rad-na noodles with chinese broccoli, the cucmber salad, and the mango with sticky rice.    The rad-na was extremely soupy with a gravy like sauce.  Way too saucy! It was ok.  We wouldn't order it again.  The eggplant had a really thick, almost unchewable skin.  Otherwise, tasty.  The mango with sticky rice was done perfecty; furthermore, it was only $3.95!?!?!? Holy moly! it's usually a $9.00 item.    Our entire bill for appetizer, 3 dishes and dessert was $30.  It won't be THE best Thai food ever but it is tasty, friendly, clean, and cheap.  I'll go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

mMEokEuSNryf7B0sMxAwdA.text: Since my hubby and I live right around the corner we decided to try this place. We were so glad we did! Before this, we always went to Archi's but since they've open we haven't been anywhere else for Thai food in the Vegas area.  They give big portions for great prices. Our favorites here are: beef larb, rad na, pad see ew, spicy egg plant (we can't eat too spicy so we opt for #3 spice) and most def the Thai ice tea. Did I mention they have a huge xl cup available for anyone who loves it? Service is always fast and friendly, even during their busiest hours.

paOLHkwXYJWhlJYAP2TD9w.text: Has become our favorite place! They deliver!!! Papaya salad and pot stickers are so amazing! I love the shrimp curry and pineapple fried rice! Always perfect and staff super friendly!

TqsPy2Ht8BN-8pLSG9F1nA.text: My husband and I love this place. It's our go to place if we are craving Thai food. We love the dry noodle, it reminds us of our trip in Thailand & had the street food. I can go on & on with their delicious food, just try it yourself and you will not be disappointed.

ajpqFeOfEA0Uoh0mt_8Y6w.text: Been coming here a while and I'm always treated nicely by all the workers. They're always smiling no matter what. Never had a bad service.

zcmNosjAW-JVngBEeZmXug.text: For this price, hard to get better thai food. I've been here over 10 times to eat and more then 10 to take out. Food quality never changed. Its good for quick n budget linch or take out, not cool for a date:)

9f5jx4bDYb3nTWid3aFVog.text: Great food and incredible value!  I discovered this place via Yelp and was so excited when they opened this location closer to my home!    We frequent this place and I've tried most of the more appealing items on the menu.  Must haves:  Coconut Water!  Try it!  It's sweet with chunks of coconut right in the glass.  Surprisingly good!  Thai style pot stickers...quality deep fried dumplings, but with a kicker.  Three different sauces on top.  Believe it or not, makes all the difference.  Amazing!  Grilled beef or pork salad.  Thai style salads are great!  Crunchy and tasty, TSNH makes one of the best.  It's a great combination of meat and veggies and priced well for the size too.  Roasted Duck Noodle Soup.  Sweet and plentiful.  You can choose your noodles, so I usually pick the thicker rice noodles and add wontons for extra heartiness.  Sweet broth goes perfectly with the duck and it's filling and good!  Tom Yum  Noodle Soup.  My friend's favorite!  Coconut base with a spicy bite.  That sweet and sour flavor is unmistakable and again, big portions, hearty and filling!  Khua Kai.  I compare this to it's chinese counterpart of fried rice noodles, but they serve it with a side of duck sauce that makes the thai version just a hair better.  Pretty simple dish, fried with scallions and egg with soy sauce, but when you mix it with the duck sauce...it's a perfect match!  Duck fried rice.  The duck adds a moist, more tender meat than your typical chicken, beef and pork.  Add that to a definite thai style of fried rice here, and it's just great fried rice!  Mangos with sweet sticky rice.  I grew up on sticky rice and this dessert runs $6 at the thai place down the street!  It's the same thing and always tastes better when it's less expensive!

Cl2AQ7gNBkVbgxF3_EvzrA.text: Good for quick and easy but super inconsistent. I've been here about 5 times and Sometimes it's great and sometimes it's just meh. Medium can be crazy spicy and hot can be mild.. It's all over the place.

5zK3_KEZKKroujjYIrYZJQ.text: We ate lunch today and once again no lunch menu offered to us. Not sure why a place would have a lunch menu and not give it to guest. They know us but still don't give it to us. I posted it in the picks. Anyway make sure to ask for the lunch menu because the price is much better.

TFUxfnC43aJyowuvw6JBTg.text: Never try Panang Avocado salmon at this restaurant, the salmon was unfreezed completely and so hard. Panang curry taste good but Salmon taste ugly, but fried calamari and combination beef noodle is good

wDoQuU0U5J6EbjkJdUBUVQ.text: My now favorite thai place.. I really enjoy there thai spicy basil & there egg drop soup

diX2fT1mgubp0ON-YjCZbg.text: The roomie and I have ordered from here a few times. Delivery was quick, prices good and the food is tasty.

owV_vXG1AM1e93AfKSPGRw.text: I'm from LA and in LA we go to Thai restaurants depending on the type of dishes we're in the mood for. Thai Noodle House has GREAT soup noodle dishes and that's my go to place when I'm craving Tom Yum Noodle Soup and Spicy Beef Soup Noodles. Their Rhad-Na noodles are the best there.. reminds me of my mom's cooking back home. Their Pad Thai is so-so and they add carrots to a lot of their dishes which I think is a little weird. Overall, the prices are great, the portions are huge, and most dishes taste great!

HnMDKkNekS35eMcHhBktWw.text: Clean, delicious food, shared crab fried rice, I had chicken noodle soup, my wife had the beef soup, both were really good lots of meat and noodles, very reasonable price for the amount of food and the quality of it. Great service. We will be back!

V2xzqACz5QYedtgN9lLIZg.text: Price is good, but service is not.  Needs more server during lunch/ dinner time.  And we don't need a male server with sagging pants.

v8hgDW52gqi9WIagvoe_DA.text: We have been looking for a good Thai place close to home.  The food and service was excellent!

53EBEjEr4vjKwRzl_IrItQ.text: i decided i was hooked on their penang curry and wanted to eat it again.  however, i got curious about their penang curry with avocado and salmon since i've read great reviews on it.  For my boyfriend, he got what he always gets, bbq chicken over fried rice.   I am saddened to say that i will be giving the cook only 2 stars.  Ever had old fish and just know its old because of the strong fishy taste?  well that's exactly how my salmon tasted.  i know what salmon tastes like and fresh salmon does not have a strong fishy odor or fishy taste.  I just did not get the same experience as everyone else who's had this.    As for my boyfriend's experience, well lets just saw that he wasn't as impressed as he was the past two times.  The fried rice was not as tasty and clearly looked like it was cooked in no more than a minute.  Of course i'm over exaggerating but its just not as great as china town location and the first time we ordered from here.

mf9DZ1gMvDbAQBwvKtCnfg.text: Good food, great price, but HORRIBLE customer service. This is the only place I know that doest answer it's phone and then hangs up on you if you let it ring, then when you call back it's busy because it's off the hook.  Guess they are not trying to actually make money? Tired of this game as this happens at least once a week to us. I'm going down the street from now on.

RRkaaSLpPYrdokfD_CYdrw.text: Ordered the pineapple fried rice with fried tofu, added-on brocolli, and no egg for yummy vegan meal. Highly recommend, but if you want it to be spicy, I suggest level 9-10. Asked for a level 7 and it was really mild!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice with fried tofu, broccoli, and no egg

DRPFQiu3WNPVVHC_5DUemw.text: I always order this through uber eats and the portions are giant for the price. It's always super hot, fresh, and delicious. I've ordered Thai through other places that aren't nearly as good for what you pay. The pad Thai and Tom kha soup are two of my faves!

Lbec0pHFzDTFd6W8Pb0biA.text: I love this place!! Pad se ew nom nom. I love that I can say vegan and they say ok. Not huh. Hahaha thanks for feeding my belly

1xBK6SBdpTKubpPiXsw2UA.text: Very authentic! The best Thai spot in Vegas in my opinion. There food is so fresh and tasty. I love that it's down the street from where we live. And the service is great

MFoWIevzqF4VIN5cMTpH7Q.text: I love this Thai place, my favorite place in Vegas for Thai food. Shrimp silver dollar is my go to dish. It's highly recommended. Two thumbs up!

RNh2CSoxC_lVG1za04tX0w.text: Live right down the street from this restaurant, me and my fiance frequent this place a lot because it's pretty good food, service is generally always great, and it's close to the house. Had a late day today and finally getting some dinner. This is the situation, How are you going to be closed when your sign is posted to be close at 10 PM and it's 9:43 PM? Called at 9:35 to place an order for pick up and no one answered the phone. Ran to the restaurant because it's around the corner from my house, came in doors were open open sign is on and they are mopping, lady at the register says sorry we are closed. Sorry Thai Noodle House 2, u suck ass. Sitting in front of the restaurant right now writing this review and its 9:46... Refuses to serve anything, whack af Thai Noodle House 2!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Notice the time 9:48 and I&#39;ve been sitting here for 10 min writing this review and the OPEN sign is on but got rejected!!!

7nhSvllKsvA2GeWZ9mO7lQ.text: Wish I lived closer. Gotta say this place has my new favorite potstickers! A must have.   Also ordered the Silver noodles with chicken and shrimps (yes the menu said shrimps...love the Asians ) asked for medium spicy and was perfect toy liking.  A busy little place at lunch time midweek, yet was still served quickly.   Great job guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Silver noodles w/chicken and Shrimps
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome potstickers
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Previous yelpers pic...wasn&#39;t adventurous enough to try it

R3Ss_UDKcydW-vxfPMyD_w.text: This is now my favorite thai place. ive been going here three times and never fails me. The price for their food is very reasonable. Dont go without trying their sticky rice for dessert, its very yummy!! I would recommend this place to all my friends and family

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice it is!!
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wrkf0s6-I7S7gBfNrivFVQ.text: So my friend took me here because they have really good fried rice dishes and soups. The duck fried rice was super yummy. The first star was lost because our first dish with sticky rice was way too small for the price.. you would probably have to order 10 of those to get full. It's the dish photographed. It tasted great, just very small for the price. The other minus was for the service, I don't think the server we had spoke a word of English. She just came and dropped off stuff. For example when she came with extra plates for me and my friend she just dumped them on the table paired instead of placing them on mine and his side. Will go back to try their Tom Ka soup but not because of the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too small! Me and my friend shared this.

QhOKP_pn6vnlLMNCC4-GNA.text: How would I describe Thai Style noodle house? Well, take one hand open it up and place something of outstanding quality there, then take the other side of your hand and also place something of really good quality there but A LOT of it, then CLAP your hands together! Aside from Hercules Hercules! What do you have? The meeting of QUALITY and QUANITY! Innovative I know, but that is exactly how I would describe this place they serve up plates and plates of delicious food and you get A LOT of it!   I have yet to be disappointed each time of come here and have explored a vast majority of the menu! Must tries are their pad Thai, duck fried rice, chicken panang, basil beef, basil fried rice and if your LAO or prefer the Lao style papaya salad rather than Thai, they have the best LAO Style papaya salad! Super great location and awesome prices. Service is also stellar. Recommended for all your savory Thai cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck fried rice

y6jwAqMaVB8miMNeBqRFow.text: I usually go to the 'Thai Style Noodle House' on Jones because I love their thai fried rice. So when I found out that there was a Thai Style Noodle House closer to my house, I had to go!  I came in with my mom and dad for dinner. I ordered (of course) the bbq pork fried rice with an egg on top, my mom ordered the pad thai, and my dad ordered the mongolian beef.  I've never actually dined in at Thai Noodle House since I usually take out and bring it to work, so this was my first time and let me just say the portion for the fried rice is huge! You can definitely share it among a couple people.  I was super satisfied with the bbq pork portion as well! Their fried rice wasn't super greasy like other thai places' tend to be.  For dessert we ordered the sticky rice with mango and this was a real winner for me. I highly recommend it! It's warm sweet sticky rice with a heavy cream on top and mango on the side. I won't be able to come here without getting it, I can tell you that.

75gVIb7OxRY3WX7qZmThRg.text: I love this place. It's yummy, service is quick, and prices are so cheap it's crazy. My favs are pineapple fried rice and pad thai. That thai spice and flavor is always there. No dish is over $10. I ordered calamari, pad Thai, pine apple fried rice, and a rice dish that came with fried chicken and my total was $30, and it fed me and my dad and sister, and we had leftovers. So good! I recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai, fried chicken with rice dish
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such good prices

fFB28q22SzbCSBa-vObgpg.text: First of all I was shocked that such amazing food existed in this area! So I was asked my buddy for a random place to eat to switch things up and keep in mind that most of the time I try new places, i never really find a satisfying place. Well this time I'm glad I founds this delicious restaurant!  I tried their yellow pumpkin curry with the spice level at a 10 out of 10 & I have to say IT WAS THE BEST CURRY I've ever tried!! I've had a lot before but this took the cake! HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO EVERYONE!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Pumpkin Curry &amp; Panyang Avocado with shrimp. Both very delicious.

YPssGwVWCzII1DpiIJhgnQ.text: I haven't had Thai Style Noodle House in quite some time, but after a great day off with one of my best friend's we decided we were in the mood for Thai food. We initially decided to head to Archi's, but ended up at Thai Style last minute.   Prices are always great here and service is good too. Since the weather is cold and I've been battling a cold, spicy was what I was craving. I went with the spicy Thai noodles and asked for a level 6 spice level. Everything was just as good as I remember and the spice level was right on mark. I didn't go too spicy since noodles tend to absorb the heat a little more than other Thai dishes. Everything was great and it made me wonder why I don't come here more often. Definitely great prices and great food in the Southwest area.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy thai noodle

egx210wBI2T87FFplL2AJQ.text: We love eating here as it is one of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas!  The food is very tasty and the prices are reasonable.  The place is small but has a relaxing atmosphere.  The service is very good.  Our food was brought out fairly quickly and it was nice and hot!  Give it a try because you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef panang curry, shrimp pad thai noodles, fried calamari and duck fried rice...yummy!

p7vKWC9U6R-sb5FiwvdLWg.text: Always spot on! The potstickers are some of the best in town! Great for take out or dining in if you time your visit right. The chicken fried chicken over fried rice, potstickers, beef salad and pineapple fried rice are really good. The only complaint I would have is you have to be carefull on your spicy level as it seems one cook goes too out and the other is just right. Always safer to go lower...

2Ht5ldtrZxldti0GwWPFcQ.text: I wish I could give it 3 and a half stars.  But I don't feel it's a 4, for sure.  Pros: Excellent, authentic Thai tea.   Service is very friendly.  Willing to accommodate special requests in your dish.  Cons:  Inconsistent quality.  And when you ask for level 1 spice out of 10, it will often be the same as when you ask for 5 or higher.  Very little chicken (which is usually tough) in the chicken curry, which includes more carrots than any other vegetable, but also includes green bell peppers, usually wilted/bitter/aging basil, and then the usual ingredients in that dish that you would expect.  Pad Thai flavor is good, but often the sprouts are old and getting slightly slimy/funky.  Chicken is a little dry and tough in this as well.

nWqEOjDHsHN9dUXZ8vhNvA.text: This was our first visit here as we had a taste for Thai. We happened to find this location and give it a try. We ordered the Edamame and chicken pad Thai. The pad Thai was great! Love the bean sprouts with the noodles! Great compliment to the dish. Customer service was awesome! We will definitely be back and will recommend to others.

xy5U1-GyzE6BgPn4bdj4IQ.text: Dined here for the first time maybe a moth ago and experience was great. Food was delicious and had a street food quality to it. Servers were nice and food came out fairly quick. We had no complaints.  2 nights ago, I called in for a pick up order and the gentleman who took our order was very rude. We were still deciding what we wanted to get and he was very impatient and had a negative tone while taking our order - we almost changed our minds and cancelled our order, but we were in a rush and already on our way to the restaurant. When I got there, I tried to pay with 2 credit cards and he wouldn't let me. When we dined inside, we paid with 2 cards no problem. Our receipt said his name was Victor.   Our food was great, just the customer service from this one employee was terrible. Go for the food, just avoid Victor.

RMUeCYcfm-dDmoU0oHpvIQ.text: I normally go to the original Noodle House, but Noodle House 2 is a lot closer to my house so I thought I'd try it out.   The inside of this one is so much nicer. More spacious, more modern, and there's actually a waiting area when the restaurant is full.   The menu is the same as the original, which I was happy to see! I ordered what I usually get (beef and broccoli) at the original house to compare it to this one. My BF ordered a combination bowl with small rice noodle. Both of the dishes weren't as good as the original house, but they weren't bad either. It was almost as if they both tasted more bland.   The servers were very nice. One of them was so engaged with his customer they were talking about boxing almost the whole time we were eating... Lol. (Go Manny!!!)  Overall we enjoyed our experience and really liked the restaurant inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried tofu :)
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination bowl with small rice noodle and beef with broccoli.

rV-t0cTxQ7-zGJ2i4-EWNA.text: Service was great, and our waitress was very friendly. But, the food was alright. We ordered the pineapple fried rice, chicken satay, duck curry, and yellow curry. The chicken satay portions were small and it wasn't that flavorful. The pineapple fried rice was very oily and greasy and didn't really have a pineapple flavor to it, but the chicken and cashews they added to it helped. The chicken curry was my favorite, it had a lot of flavor and the portions for the curry were quite big. A bowl of rice came with the chicken curry. We ordered mild spice for the curries, but it was a little spicy. Place was small but, a lot of families were coming in and out to eat dinner, so it's a good place to eat with family or a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AyRCJ0U487INtOlpla7O7w.text: I walked in 20 minutes before they closed and let me tell you....I had the BEST customer service ever!!! I wasn't rushed at all. The dish I ordered had avocado in it and they ran out. Never fear!!!! They added a double portion of chicken and shrimp!! Yayyyyyyy!!! Please chk this place out. You won't be disappointed. Promise !!!!

MZFAJ5ilOqsj5_rSFhcLRQ.text: Love this place! After literally trying over 10 different Thai restaurant, this is my all time fave. Delicious Thai food with great portions and prices! You won't be disappointed! FYI the decor is ok but food is five stars!

rouqeVzSw5bnySZrJAvKhQ.text: Love this place. It's small, quaint. It's our family's go-to spot for Thai, the staff is amazing, they always treat us like they know us (and they probably do judging by how often we go in) and the food has never disappointed. Let's talk Thai tea... had Thai tea at several different places, just depending on what part of town I'm in, and it's always pretty standard across the bar, but this place has a little something extra in their Thai tea. I can't put my finger on what the extra taste is, but it's AMAZING! Give it a try...you won't be disappointed!

oi-CMhmj1Dahj9IwvjTEZg.text: Solid Thai restaurant. I had the avocado curry with shrimp. Their medium is actually close to what I'd say is a medium, unlike many places that go light on spice. The dish is a good deal for the price too, not overly large but sufficiently filling, and the flavor is solid. I was also satisfied with the service. I'd go back again.

RvpRMDbTfU4s9IgM7mm3DA.text: I've been here a few times and other locations as well but this one tops them all. I love the customer service and the food seems to be a lot more tasty here. I made a to-go order of calamari, spicy eggplant with chicken, spicy basil with beef, and crab fried rice! Oooh, did I get your mouth all watery just yet??? Everything was cooked to the tee, flavored so well, and just on point! We've also tried the pad Thai and papaya salad which always hits home! If you're craving for Thai food, this is the place to be! Unbeatable prices for the portions you get and definitely worth every bite!

qfrqyJrfumjjVPCJRGiqow.text: This is our 2nd or 3rd time eating here. Always good service & food. We enjoyed the calamari, Larb, and pad Thai - deliciousness! I also like the menu is affordable. If you enjoy Thai food, you won't be disappointed!

FAU8VCNu8Eo4wtv-zUaNww.text: This is a little family owned business or so it seemed.  Very busy restaurant with a lot of phone orders.  The kitchen is very busy so when we arrived, sat down, and ordered, it took awhile to get the food.  The waitress was nice and you can constantly see the 2 people in the front moving back and forth.  The food deserved 5 stars.  It was very good and the prices were good so I can see why they were so busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lE6H2r7r_9YgWB3UH3GQfQ.text: Love their Spicy Eggplant with ground beef spicy level 10, however they don't have chilly in fish oil oh well I got mine at home.

WbnLj_7458q6t-7x1IBuog.text: To say that I'll be back after today's experience is an understatement.   My bf & I were a bit skeptical after having seen this place before, but I'm glad that even if we had been here before, we decided to try it one more time.   We ended up coming in right around 12:30pm, a time where usually Thai restaurants are fairly busy -- but this one wasn't!   We sat down, and without having to ask, water was served (always a PLUS). The prices on the menu are more than reasonable...I believe almost all of the items were under $10 -- and the menu is EXTENSIVE.  I ordered my favorite item, Papaya Salad (medium spice) & my bf ended up getting Kung Pao Shrimp. The papaya salad was AWESOME SAUCE. It was a rather spicy, probably more than medium spice, but it was delicious. The kung pao shrimp was very good too. I loved the black bean sauce. It was sauteed until the onions and peppers were tender. ALL THE BETTER.   I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung Pao Shrimp, medium spice
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad, Medium Spice ($6.50)

gow60BufIwTkVAh7JmnkwA.text: Tried this place out yesterday, had the papaya salad, green curry and sticky rice and mango. All were amazing, good portions and great value. Will definitely return.

kmQWV7Pl8wCC_-EmjJIzDA.text: *** update I have now been harassed 2 times by profiles the owner instead of trying to make it right is now sending foul messages to me directly. *** I have been to this location many times and I have to say I usually enjoy anything that I order and usually the service is amazing but today I went in and ordered my usual broth and was met by complete rudeness. By only a person that I can assume is the owner. he is a man that I have never seen her before but it seems like he rather be anywhere else but running his business. The fact he was demeaning to his staff on top of it made me say scratch my order and I will never order or put money into the pockets of such an a**hole.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P8ahxuG_RAdK5OtgHm1KSw.text: My bf got the thai shrimp fried rice, which was pretty good, while I got a pad thai and it was decent. I should have asked about spicy levels because it was 60% sweet and 40% savory for me. For the large portions, it's very affordable, so I'll come back and try again prepared. I'm just new to the area and shy, so I hope to update this review in the future.

u1bHlMX5tZLjW64z_X-hEw.text: Came in for lunch yesterday. A lady quickly pointed out a table for us to be seated.  Ordered the Seafood Tom Yum Rice Noodle Soup in mild. I didn't wait long before it was brought out to me. Love the soup (sour and spicy) and there was tons of it (couldn't even finish drinking it all). Seafood included slices of fish cakes, shrimp, mussel, and fish balls. It would have been perfect if they threw some mushrooms in there.   Service was alright. Took a long while before they even brought out my husband's lunch. And when they did, they didn't bring him anything to eat it with. Had to ask for the condiments as well since there was none on our table.    This seem to be the only Thai restaurant in the surrounding area. Not the best Thai food I ever had but will do when it comes to satisfying that sudden Thai craving.

Z6hs2927fLfsCU5tKJoemQ.text: This place is horrible now with the new owners. The take out order are not what you order because the lady who took the order wrote it down wrong. I called to explain what was missing (a piece of fried chicken) and she told me to come all the way back and pay for it when I already did. I told her to just make the chicken and I swing by to pick it up but no she demands me to pay or nothing. I asked her for her name and to speak to the owners and she refused and hung up on me. Totally rude and horrible customer service. My family used to eat her every two weeks and notice that food tasted different lately and now we know why.

nhCXr3qqchttX-O7xaboiQ.text: I was in the mood for something fast and more on the healthy side, so I ordered take out from here last night by phone. The lady who took my order was neutral but courteous, and she repeated my order correctly without me asking. I ordered the Khua-Kai rice noodles, Beef Basil fried rice, the Choo-chee Chicken Curry, an order of potstickers, and two Thai teas. Everything turned out to be good and tasty, especially the Curry! I didn't even notice that the Basil Beef I ordered came with the rice on the side instead of everything fried together...actually I just thought of it now, so it was obviously that good! The potstickers came with a few sauces drizzled on top, which was nice because it was already prepared. Also, I usually order the Thai tea without ice, so it doesn't get diluted and when I get home I dilute the tea with some of my own tea because it is really, very sweet and I get a few more glasses out of it.   I would prefer to dine-in because I think they are more generous with the portions as opposed to how much they serve with take out. However, it was still filling, delicious, and not so heavy! Everything was also affordable at just under $37. And at the end of this dinner, you don't feel like you undid your entire week of working out on just one meal :)

NiDkh9G9tkuqkYgZZc3x7Q.text: A good place to get Thai food that I close by our house. The prices are good too! Would def recommend!

eZcPivP7pFgTKKt1C0GWXA.text: Definitely my go to Thai place in vegas. This place is definitely budget friendly and the food is on point. Their staples of pad see ew, Tom yum, Tom Kah, mint leaf beef, and currys are all good. From their chef specials the ginger snapper with crispy fish is a good choice when you don't want meat, and their mootod is this crispy pork that has this citrus salty jalapeno  dipping sauce is yummy. I have pretty much tried everything on the menu and it never disappoints.. when they do have mango sticky rice in season that's always a great way to end your meal here. Oh and if you live close by they deliver!

G-4rUD6SWUBQtU5YYy0EWw.text: They always deliver good food for a very fair price. The service is good too. Not the best thai food I've ever had but overall they're good.

dS__dXWrHey7zAPYqWbRQg.text: Best thai on this side of town for sure. Everything I've ever ordered was delicious and reasonably priced!

Z21IbfMY7pSai4ITfvKw5Q.text: This place should be on the top Thai Restaurants in Las Vegas. Their food tastes amazing compared to others. This is our new favorite place to eat Thai food. Best Pad Thai and Penang Curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7LwOkQmUN0VxWumwU3iDrA.text: We went to noodle house 2 on ft. apache and trop and it was the best thai we have had in vegas. We normally go to arayna or sweet basil as we look for dining options on the west side / summerlin area. Service was great. Host was great. Atmosphere was nicely decorated with good luck elephants. I asked to have us brought best dishes. We received the house special flat noodle with secret tangy sauce. I reccomend. And then the avocado pantang. Beat curry in vegas. Avocado was perfectly ripe and the shrimp went terrific with it. Make sure to order a thai coffee. Delicious with meal or just to lounge about.

gfwlTWTF4OCCtMEEF0BOUg.text: We have eaten here for years. Over the past couple of years we have seen the quality of the food and the service deteriorate. The chairs are filthy. The menus old, dirty and damaged. Prices have always been great, but we may have to look for a new Thai restaurant as the staff, chef and management seem to have lost their passion. The owners need to CLEAN the place and replace the chairs and menus. The servers need uniforms and worst of all, the food quality has suffered and rarely does a full table of food come out at the same time. We really have enjoyed Thai Noodle 2, but if they don't improve the dining experience, we will not return.

bUXX_hvDsyfNcp61qOkRFg.text: I'm usually never on this side of town so thanks to my fellow Yelpers for convincing me to try this place out. There were many other great choices I had near the area but so glad I chose this one.  Small, cozy little restaurant with a pretty big menu and really great prices. I had the hardest time deciding but I went with the panang chicken and some fried flat noodles.  The noodles came out first and I had planned to eat only half of it while the panang was coming out. Well, I've never been good on that portion control thingy and I ended up scarfing the whole plate of noodles down. It came with Thai sweet chili sauce and I added sriracha on top of all that. Very delicious, better than my usual pad see ew.   The panang was simple, not filled with bamboo shoots and other veggies. Just a nice thick curry sauce and some red pepper flakes and of course the chicken. Although I don't mind bamboo and veggies I prefer my panang simply made like this. It was a little bit salty which may be bad for most but I loved it cuz I am a sodium freak.  I would love to come back and try all the other dishes. The Thai beef noodle soup and grilled meat dishes looked really good. The service was very friendly and attentive.  The great thing is that this isn't their only location. Phewww, cuz out of all 3 this was the furthest from my house. But if  this were the only location, I would definetly come back here. Next time, I'll be going to either the Chinatown location or the one in Summerlin.

IwjfNPViI-tGquCbKM0lMw.text: Great eats - homestyle thai food. Curries, noodles, noodle soups, and the lot. All tasty. Havent had a boring dish yet. Best part us that they deliver, too!

Ub2R3NQAnemQzyAh39H7eg.text: Delicious, cheap Thai food! I've been to the Chinatown location, but I think this location definitely is less crowded, looks newer/cleaner, and has better service.  It may be that I'm not observant but I don't remember the other location having duck as an option for the noodle dishes.  Pad see ew with duck is definitely better than the beef, chicken, etc options.  The tender slices of roast duck are nicely seasoned.  We also tried some appetizers, the crispy calamari is fried to perfection.  The fried chicken wings were disappointing, fried until they were slightly jerky in texture and no crispy crunch to the outside =(.  But overall, great place with great food....and helps that it's a few doors down from Sweet Addictions! Definitely head over there for an ice cream sandwich dessert!

GoEg7C717U3l0i3AzRCaxQ.text: Absolutely love this place! My only thing I ever order is the Duck Fried rice with no pineapple or tomatoes. Service takes a little while to come out and customer service could use a LOT of work but food is delicious no doubt!   My first time I tried this place the 2 younger staff assisting had an attitude and ignored my table for the longest time and when I needed something I would ALWAYS have to flag them down. But when the owners/managers(or what they seem to be) are around they're always asking how I am doing. Esp the older asian lady who is there day in and day out :)

OhC3IsFR7iHHiWzf4drzuQ.text: Seriously the rudest encounter of my life. They tried to give me half my food for full price and then when I asked if this was correct they fixed it with the most attitude possible. The foods good but the workers are not. Definetly never coming here again.

p91ewGQ_DUG5MjviMiv81g.text: One of the best bangs for the buck in the Las Wegas!  No that's not a typo even though there currently is a red squiggly telling me to fix that.  Thai beef salad, if you were a woman, I would compare you to Paris Hilton... you are cheap and delicious!!    Side of fried rice, damn you I can't stop eating you!!!!!  I have nothing else for you, this restaurant is the bomb, it has multiple locations, that's how good it is, people just can't have it one spot.

dcwXJeIV5zHQjQQEmb6XxQ.text: I come in at least once a week. My favorite is their combination beef noodle soup. I've tried other dishes as well like the spicy basil beef,  spicy eggplant, and spicy string bean to name a few. They were great. I would recommend this place for their good food and value.

mwO9huJ5MlUXz_waD-DNgA.text: First things first: this would be a five star review, however they were out of panang curry when I visited last...this will easily be bumped that extra star if this was an isolated incident.  I loved that panang!  Thai Style Noodle House was a real treat.  This location is a few suites down from Waffles Cafe on Fort Apache.  During one of my visits to Waffles Cafe, I saw that the staff was ordering Thai food; within 20 mins the food was delivered.  After some investigation I saw that Thai Style Noodle House had recently opened this location.  Later that week I stopped by for dinner and ordered a chef special, panang curry with avocado and salmon.  This was simply...awesome.  For my curry fix I've been going to Archi's...if only I found Thai Style sooner!  The avocado was a bit hard, but the flavor of the panang brought a smile to my face with each bite.  I ordered it at a 5 out of 10 on the hot scale, and it was what I expected.  After a second visit, they've been consistent with their scale through the four dishes that I've thus tried.  Since then I've had the papaya salad, red curry, and the pad see ew.  After adding some chili powder to the papaya for a little more kick, it became a great side dish to the entrees.  The red curry was good, but I enjoyed the panang a lot more (they were out of panang this night).  And the pad see ew was a very pleasant surprise!  I've had this dish before at other restaurants, and it came out oily and bland.  But here the noodles were cooked perfectly and mixed in with egg and beef, creating a lovely texture with the soft egg and noodles giving way to the thinly sliced beef.    I've been expanding my tastes recently when it comes to Thai cuisine, and I can't wait for my next visit to Thai Style!

photos.caption: Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Curry with Chicken
Photo of Thai Style Noodle House 2 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad

yIJuo-bYlcEvzJZUVFXblQ.text: I was really pleased with our trip to this spot.  The restaurant was really cute, the service was exceptional, and the food was great.   The Tom Kha was probably the best I've had in Vegas.  The flavor was spot on.  The Pad See Eu really stood out as well.  It ties for my favorite with The King and I (at The Lakes).   I'm removing one star because the dish my boyfriend ordered (a flat noodle dish, with chicken, and Thai style gravy) was really gross.  I don't know if it just wasn't our thing...but this was something else.  The gravy was...abundant, and slimy.  I tried to give this a shot after refrigeration, when the gravy "settled", but it still looked very visually off-putting, and really didn't taste that great.   Other than the one disappointing dish, our visit went great.  I'm sure we'll be back.

Y1cbBMAOFe_USXzGyBlOLw.text: Thai Style Noodle House of Chinatown has expanded to the southwest side, in the same plaza as Waffles Cafe. The restaurant has been called the best Thai Restaurant in Vegas (not Lotus of Siam),  so there is pressure for this restaurant to deliver if its to carry the Thai Style Noodle House name and it does!  @ NH Style Potstickers - This was a delicious appetizer taking a book from the Japanese drizzling spicy mayo, eel sauce, and some hot sauce. Sprinkled on top is some sesame seeds, white onions, and green onions. The only issue with this item was the wonton wrap was fried a little bit too much so it was hard, not crispy. I told the waiter and the manager thanked me for it and gave me the item half off. Yay! Hopefully in the future they'll fix this issue.   @ Seafood Wonton Soup w/ Rice Noodles - This place sure gets you your money worth. Filling the noodles with wontons, shrimp, fish balls, sea cucumber,  clams, and fish. The chicken broth is a clean tasting and delicious. A good fulfilling and delicious dish for $7.60.  This place opened this past week and looks like they're getting some foot traffic already.  The decor is nice, doesn't look like the hole in the wall Chinatown version. The fake granite tables, copper ceiling, and simple layout makes this an inviting place to come eat.   Service is very friendly and attentive. When I explained to them my concerns for one of their appetizer, they were genuinely appreciative. This is a rare thing to find.  A new restaurant (kind of) that delivers the first time, with some minor issues. Great food and service makes you consider going to this place over the other surrounding Thai restaurants.

JNW_3mbF3ywtuVIif4KBRA.text: Will return here for sure.  Great food for the price!  Pork jerky = 9.  Silver noodle salad= 8.5 beef soup=7 and Thai fried rice= 9.5,  service=10

KLYHJgnLC1sr9aXSlMI5CQ.text: I love this restaurant. This place is right by my house so it's a very convenient location. First of all the food is really good, I always order the beef ball noodle soup (similar to pho) and the fried snapper with chili sauce, which is absolutely to die for. Their Thai iced tea and appetizers are delicious as well. 5 stars for good food and great service.

s0-zXsav25IJVwH0u8bfOQ.text: Really good, fresh, noodles and rice dishes. I have eaten there twice and had great food and service. They will prepare your order with the spiciness of your choosing. Have tried the egg rolls for appetizer, 2 styles of phad thai, and 2 style of thai fried rice. All were prepared just as we ordered. The egg rolls are so crisp! Cannot wait to try more items on the menu.

99dQut8LgRPIVMwuimicIQ.text: We waited about 25 minutes to put in our drink order, then we both had straw paper in our water. The pad thai had very little flavor and the noodles were soggy.  However the glass noodle soup was decent probably some of the top 10 noodle soups I've ever had. Probably wont be back.

gc-RIr4cABpYqPQgKeTBuQ.text: One of the better Thai places I've tried in town. The restaurant is nice, clean and spacious, and the service is friendly. The menu prices are definitely a steal compared to other Thai places I've been to, and the menu choices are diverse ranging from classic curries to a variety of noodles (each with a description).   Wanting something healthy, I ordered the Papaya Salad- crunchy julienned green papaya, peanuts and tomatoes tossed together in a sour, sweet, and slightly spicy (level 3) vinaigrette. The vinaigrette also had fish sauce in it, so if you're not a fan of fish sauce, I'd recommend something else. On the side of the heap of papaya salad were a few pieces of cabbage. The salad was refreshing and light. My only complaints are: 1) The tomato pieces on top were mushy; and 2) I wish they added more peanuts. The peanuts added depth to the salad, and cut the vinegary-ness of the dressing. Overall, however, I enjoyed the salad very much. I also tried a bit of the Green Curry w/ brown rice which was really yummy. Spicy, but not too spicy. Sweet, but not too sweet. Just really tasty.  I also am a fan of the water! They put slices of fruit (lemons, strawberries & green apples) in the water pitcher, which I thought was pretty and gave the water a nice taste. The server made sure my water glass was never empty.   I definitely want to come back to try their noodle dishes (Apparently, the duck noodle soup is amazing). Good eats.

nVLE1iR1NTpAna-S1Q4C_Q.text: Great food with great time management. I come here kind of often but this time, the service was S H I T. The neglected and I find it very unprofessional when the employees are eating right in front of us.  It's a bit small but most of the time the place is vacant  I ordered the bbq Chicken over fried rice and it is one of my fav dish on the menu. It's delicious with the sauce!! ($6.95) Rating- 8.9  Also I got the Panang curry spicy 5. I wish there was more green peppers and meat rather than sauce. It's enough to fill one to two people. ($6.95) Rating- 7.7  Definitely give this plAce a try if you're into thai food :)

DjtIX2iOL_ssMx1Acc6Esw.text: Really like this place! The soups and noodles are great. I specially like tom kha and beef noodle soup. Fried rice is wicked too. Pineapple rice is delicious.  I have a weird habit of having dinner here after a long day in the office. Soups are healthy, big, and cheap. Best meal under $10!

e3UEFQPUGymuqqqN5OmHOw.text: Panang curry all the way\!  Yellow & Red Curry were good too!  Or even just the hot & sour soup.  Star system is based on 1-10, not traditional 1-5, FYI.  But if not hot enough dining in, the will bring the condiments to bring up the heat, so don't you worry.  3rd time going to give a final 'overview' of this place. Full of spice, they offer lunch specials, AND THEY DELIVER!! (limited)$15minimum for CC purchases, which is fine as food is worth getting again.  I also recommend take-away, as when I was there, multiple orders were lined up for patrons to come in and pick up.

BPPsfBL5_XDEhGn_2kQ3eA.text: Love this place, been going there since they opened.. Cheap and the food tastes good. Love the spicy basil chicken, spicy string beans, and the yellow curry.

3El7d9fjuyv2JjctZpLD0A.text: So my friend and I have had lunch here 3 times.... Food is actually very good and prices affordable, but the SERVICE is HORRIBLE!! Your afraid to even ask for utensils. The last server we had was a male and he had a personality of a chopstick. When you asked for anything he looked at us like we were ridiculous for asking for napkins (hence nothing was on the tables... no utensils, napkins, condiments).  I know it's just lunch but it is a sit down place n you are paying gratuity, make some effort to make your customers feel comfortable while eating at your establishment;(

Ub9VzzyGxUugWBOeB8yo2A.text: I have been to both the Spring Valley and Chinatown location. Each time I have been I receive consistent good quality service and food. They use fresh ingredients. I am a vegetarian so I love that they offer all dishes as vegetarian. They are one of the few, so many places in Chinatown only have one or two vegetarian options. I strongly recommend the spicy green bean (because it is already spicy no need to go more than 3 stars on the heat) Also, the Tom Kha soup is delicious. This place could be my new fast-food go to.

y2xadn9YvYqwC0nC7T66Og.text: My boyfriend placed 2 orders of fried calamari to go, and when we got home I was so upset. What we got today in two boxes equals the amount of food we were served with one order the previous week. So disappionting!  There're only probably 10 pieces in each box :(

8Be4oNNPNz6qgLz5NdHnaA.text: Tasty food but they overly charged for delivery even when ur really close to the restaurant...

DSqPe4JFmkDl2XaUGKWq4w.text: I decided to check it out because of the reviews and honestly probably one of the worst thai food I. 've ever had. I ordered the pumpkin yellow curry and it tasted like salt and no spices. Also, I could tell it's been sitting in the back for a while and was just continuously reheated due to that the potato's were mashed into the sauce. The reason I am giving two starts is because the service was really good and big portions.  Pros: Big portion, great service Cons: Yellow curry

Y1Idj9SGxEWGc-WRLGdZxw.text: It seems that the owners of Thai Style noodle house like to compete with other Thai restaurants. Their location in Chinatown is surrounded by Thai places and on Fort Apache theres an abundant amount of Thai places. I don't think TSNH is a knock out for the other restaurants its competing against, but its cheap.  The value of the items you order is a great bang for the buck and they have a large variety of noodles. Although it always weirds me out when I see a Thai restaurant sell won ton noodles.   Sometimes the wait time is a bit long (I see an elderly thai lady working in the kitchen which is a good and bad thing). If you come here in a party, I would probably skip the chef specials, not because they're not good, but because you'll probably be waiting another 10 minutes or so while your friends are grubbing.   Oh yeah, I find it a little weird that not all their drinking glasses are the same color. I think its a little weird when we get 7 waters and 3 are in clear glasses while the other 4 are in red.  The service is nice though, never really had a problem with any orders.  THE SUMMARY: cheap, variety, long wait, weird cups, decent service.

X_tq_L8QSi4Bl8hEcyk5Uw.text: Sooooooo Dang good. Very fresh and fast, I will be back next time I am in Vegas

yAzYqINRqiOzFfVzOiio9Q.text: I'm so glad we came here! Food was awesome!!! We ordered the Thai fried rice,  wonton soup and the pad Thai ; all dishes were great. Clean flavors, fresh and perfectly seasoned! Service was good too. The young girl who helped us was very nice, same with the young guy. The older lady, maybe the manager or owner, not as friendly but I think maybe she is just too focused in the business. Prices are ridiculously low, less than $7 for most dishes. Highly recommend it !

gDx3TxyNgwC1jnJyMRCs9Q.text: As an obsessed, official Duchess of the original location, I felt obligated to try #2! We sampled lunch, and for some reason, I wanted to sample something different, so I didn't go for my usual curry. I ordered up some stir fried broccoli. Yes, American broccoli. I love it, and I wanted it. The dish was very simple and fresh. The green goods in a light sauce, which was similar to a brown sauce you might get at a Chinese restaurant. Of course, they have brown rice, but they do charge a bit extra now (.75).   One thing that I did discover on this trip was the assortment of Thai condiments in little glass jars on the table. I had never used them before, but I decided, "Why the heck not?" Good decision on my part, as I am a big fan of the jalapenos and will probably add them on to all of my future dishes at Thai Style. A couple of those on some brown rice and I could be pretty happy. Yes, I am officially a cheap date.  Of course, the thing to note is the beautiful, new interior, which is very different from the hole-in-the-wall style of the original. Each has its own charm.   Service was great. We even saw some familiar faces from #1. From what I can tell, they are going to be able to maintain quality at both locations. There were a couple of bumps while they were getting in new chefs for both locations, but based on my recent visits, both spots seem to be on the right track for tastiness!

tcNtZOsNKBP5rr0nfvMBZw.text: My favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant and there are 5 within 1 mile of each other in thus area! Inexpensive, fast and tasty. Try the pot stickers, Kau Kai , duck soup and eggplant. The orange chicken is in a batter so light and fluffy we renamed it doughnut chicken. All but one of the wait staff are friendly and efficient. If you get the girl who invests in her appearance and not her personality or profession, your order will be wrong and you will be asking for essentials like forks and your drinks, getting nothing but attitude.

iC-pdf-Jzo5hB-U0p2SHWg.text: I had gone in today for lunch and looked at their menu for their lunch specials. Not sure why they didn't just give the lunch special menu like they do at their 3rd location in Summerlin. When you go for lunch be sure to ask for the lunch special menu. So much food! They currently have a 5.99 1 item combo with soup, rice and fried item. Add an additional item if you're hungry for 7.99. Their lunch menu encompasses a lot of choices from spicy eggplant to various curries. Mind you they don't do pad thai for the lunch special. But you won't miss it with all the other items they offer. And the prices can't be beat.

7fX1RhDqPrTUtnDuKk2ZYQ.text: I love the place simply because the food is very good for the price, its just that simple, not to mention Victor is my BOIIII...

wpoQxzP7rCNgBvKtwCNvOQ.text: Haven't gone here in a long time and I have to say things haven't changed.   I decided to see if it had gotten any better, I am referring to the service. it doesn't matter who you get they are all equally terrible and rude. This will be my very last visit here since nothing will ever change.   I ordered a Thai Chai tea with milk (cold version). The lady delivers my drink and I tasted it and it was pure sugar you couldn't taste anything else but sugar! On prior occasions this was not the case! I asked her to take it back and add more milk less Thai tea. So she brings it back but no change at all even after adding more milk. So after taking one sip I told her I could not drink it and she actually had the $&@;! to tell me not to order it again that it would always be like that. She was lecturing me like a child and for the sake of not making a usual scene like I would if I was alone. This time I was quiet and didn't talk back.   So it's safe to say if you like crappy service and being lectured just go here!

538kugm9VSXBakpzAIq1eg.text: We got some take out while driving past, and we're so happy that we did! Great price for good food. We've only had it once, but will definitely be returning. We tried a green curry, pad thai, and an appetizer sampler. Everything tasted fresh, and it was of course a nice treat the following day as well. We will definitely be back.

0w_DiPkcQN0FBUQ3oCaliQ.text: Seriously the greatest place to get Thai food in Vegas. Their soups are the amazing they have so many choices and you get a huge bowl! Tom Kha is best one. Thai iced tea delicious too. Best bang for your buck.
